Also, make yourself a bowl of brown rice and put a scoop of the chicken soup in it. Its awesome and free!

Good food.  Large portion.  The small size is Huuuuuuge! The interior of the store needs some love. Feels a little lonely and forgotten. I like Ghengis Grill more as far as taste and ambiance go.  Ghengis Grill offers way better seasonings and marinated meats. The portion sizes here are way bigger however. The soup is a nice option.

Well considering I am not a big fan of Stir fry after a very bad experience I had at a place like this a few years ago....I was skeptical about this place. My wife wanted to really try it...so we decided to visit this locale before going to the movies. I have to say for the 21.00 bucks I spent for the 2 of us I was not disappointed at all. The food was very good....the service was first class....and the meal comes with a drink and dessert as well. However do keep in mind if you decide to do the "One bowl, One trip" deal you can take your food with you....but if you do the buffet....and eat in then you cannot take anything with you. This establishment is within walking distance of the Ultrastar Cinema and a great place to get a great meal before you see your show. Eat, Drink, and be Merry my Friends!!!!

My family and I really enjoy eating here.  Where else can you play with your food and not get in trouble?  Don't forget to purchase your doggy bag before you leave the register ($0.50)!  Trust me, you'll need it.    Yummy Asian food that you can make anyway you like!  Make sure to use more meat than you think you have if its your first time.  It is afterall the amazing shrinking meat.  Lots of choices in meat, vegetarian options, noodles, and sauces.  Once your plate is cooked, you can head over to get some rice or ice cream too!  This meal typically last three days for us.  And for $10!  The only reasons it did not get 5 stars from me is it isn't always quick service at the cooking stations and buffet area tends to get messy if not frequently checked on.  But it is a buffet, so I guess that is expected.

Best time to go is lunch time so you can pack your bowl so full of deliciousness!!! I usually pack enough for 2 cartons so I can eat lunch, dinner AND lunch the next day. They are always have fresh tasting food and they workers are so nice and they love to help you with anything you need.

Been coming here for 15 years....  Pro's - variety on bowl options many - quality of produce good - staff friendly and helpful  Con's - maybe a tad over priced by $1 or so.  Never liked the new smaller metal bowls.   Will continue visiting from time to time...
Heaven in a hot bowl!  I've been coming here for 15+ years and everyone I bring become immediately addicted.  Once you learn how to make your bowl the way you like it, you are set

My family and I come here once every month or two. It's a fun concept to actually make your own bowl, your own sauce and watch it be cooked. The food is always tasty and we always have leftovers which actually heat up the next day quite well. I would have given 5 stars but you have to pay for your leftover containers and I think this is silly given the bowls are pretty pricey to begin with. If their takeout containers are that costly to them, shop for a new provider?

This place was recommended by my co workers and I am so GLAD I went. As soon as we walked in they were super friendly said hello and helped me through their selection. Then we walked over to the line of food to start filling out bowls. Wow they had quite the selection of vegetables and protein even tofu. As we got closer to the sauces a very nice lady, Janet helped me with putting my perfect sauce together and let me tell you it was the perfect taste. Then we took our food to the grill and they started cooking away which was done very quick and the gentlemen was also very nice. All around this by far has been a great experience.  Food was delicious Presentation looked great Staff was friendly  Fast but quality service   I will be back :)

Tasty. Great healthy options. The hostess was delightful and extremely helpful. I went in for lunch, got the large and had enough leftover for dinner. I wish it was closer to home, but will be back when I'm in the area.

We love this place!  My kids beg to come here and every time we do everyone is full, happy, satisfied and has leftovers for lunch the next day.  The new remodel looks awesome.  The elevated tables are super cool and my kids loved sitting at them.  If you've never been I highly recommend this place.  It's delicious.
Real bang for your buck. If you don't know how to make your sauce then I highly suggest asking for help. Staff is super friendly - don't forget to tip and food is awesome!

I've been coming here since I was a kid and absolutely love this place. If you have never been just know that the raw food looks like a lot but it cooks down to about half the size so pack the food in. You get to make your own sauce I recommend the chiefs choice thats my favorite and I add some of the spicy thai sauce to give it a little kick its not too hot.

I was contacted by owner to apologize for the meal below, even though it was not necessary to do so. My family didn't think anything wrong was done on YC's end, just a bad luck timing. So when I got a reply it was not expected, but we greatly appreciate him in doing so. They go above and beyond for their customers and should be thanked! THANK YOU!

Let me start out by saying that this is the first negative review I've ever felt compelled enough to write after eating at hundreds of restaurants with my girlfriend. Also, as a server for multiple years I know what it takes to give good service. I visited with my girlfriend at 8pm, on October 23rd. I had already eaten dinner and was just going for a quick bite for my girlfriend after her shift at work. We go in and get greeted by a tired sounded host. I still gave him a 20 percent tip because I know how hard work can be sometimes. The total came out to 16 dollars! 16 dollars seems a little pricey for chicken and noodles but it's okay because it was only place nearby and she was hungry. After sitting down and letting her eat a bit, I get a fork to try a bite of her food. Once again, I already ate so I'm not hungry just wanted a bite and I get told, "if you want to buy a bowl you can but don't eat off hers. WTF. The only time I am spoken too for my 20 percent tip is an inconsiderate comment about not be able to try my girlfriends food I paid for. Again I work in the food industry and I know sometimes there's bs rules but there has to be a better way to word that to someone who just tipped you. Ex, I'm sorry to say this sir but company policy says you can't share food, thank you. Well I was offended and my girlfriend knew so she just asked for a box. The same 'friendly man' let's her know that we usually have to charge for this but just this once he will give it to her for free. Like what. This is a consumer world so I urge all the consumers reading this to take your money elsewhere where it is valued. Believe me, I live in this area and there are about a million other places that treat you better than this. And you get more food at a cheaper price! Never again.  UPDATE: the owner has reached out and offered to make it up to me for the visit. I'm impressed with how quick they responded.  UPDATE: I finally decided to give the place a second shot and it was awesome!!!! The staff was super friendly and helped accommodate with sauces. I left my original review because I think it's important to learn from their mistakes.

Nice vibe, good  protein and veggie choices and sauce options to make your stir fry your way, including the drink, soup and fro-yo what is not to like for $10.75. You will not leave here hungry and you will have plenty for leftovers. I will be back.

Been to multiple Mongolian bbqs around California and Nevada and this is by far the best. The ability to add as much meat (chicken, beef, Turkey, pork and fish) as you want not to mention the unlimited veggies puts this place above others.  They also give you the ability to make your own sauce recipes. You can choose curry, sweet and sour, teriyaki, soy sauce combos, amongst others. This plus the unlimited drinks makes this place stand above the rest.  I highly recommend this place.
Lots of variety. Yummy sauces to mix. Excellent staff. Great prices

Well if you are good at packing food into a bowl, then you'll love this place. You can order a large or a small bowl... which I think you still can get as much as a large bowl if you pack enough into a small bowl. But anyway, you go through a buffet style line, stuffing meat, veggies and noodles into a bowl before they stir fry it for you. At this location, you start with the meats. There are beef, white chicken, dark chicken and Alaskan Cod. Compare to other places, the meat selection is quite limited. Even though vegetables which include tofu, baby corn, carrots, broccoli, bean sprouts, etc., are also a limited selection. There are a variety of sauces that you can mix or you can follow the recipe on the menu.  I guess the good thing is for $11, you can get a huge bowl of food. And there's free soup, which is ok... but you do also get a free drink (tea, soda) and you can buy yogurt for one dollar! So for the amount of money you pay, you get a lot of food. So I would say it's a good place to go for food. Just do it when it's not busy so you have more time to pack your bowl with ingredients. Be sure to make a mountain, get a lot of meat, a small portion of vegetables and keep piling whatever else on until it literally starts falling out of the bowl. LOL. And then you'll get your money's worth.

Love ycs! You can get more food if you get it to go from the start, they will give you containers for soups, chips and rice plus all your food in to-go containers, whereas if you eat there, you have to buy doggie bags.

Best place to eat Mongolian grill food...you can load up a bowl, have them cook it as long as you want, and it is always delicious, cheap, and super super filling.  I love to gorge myself at this place.  The location in Gilbert and the one in Scottsdale are both excellent as well.  The place is always spot-on delicious!!

Amazing food here. My co worker is a vegan and the chef cleaned the hot plate off before cooking his tofu on it. I strongly suggest coming here. Around noon it gets kind of crazy in there but the staff and facility can handle the rush. I suggest the chicken woth udon noodles and broccoli and get creative with the sauces at the end. The staff can help you but if you like to make your own go for it.
Just happened to be passing by and decided to try this place. So glad I did. The food is great, the selection was great and the staff is friendly and very helpful. Don't pass this delicious meal up.
Totally awesome food and great staff. The food was as fresh as can be and they are very conscientious about food allergies. Can't wait to go back.

I wish I could give five stars, however, one of the best reasons why I came here to eat was because they had caffeine free DIET soda. I don't drink caffeine after noon and I could come here and fix my food that way I want too and also have a bubbly drink.   I was shocked when they had no caffeine free diet soda. I asked and the management recently changed form Coke to Pepsi products and out went the caffeine free diet soda. So they do not have s price for dinner that doesn't include the drink. So I paid for something I didn't drink. Also no soda water.   While I love making my own food and the fresh veggies and quantity you can make, I probably won't be back for lunch or dinner. This place was founded on health and healthy choices. So I say offer a wide variety of drinks for all and not just some.  I was extremely disappointed on this visit

most mongolian grills allow you to decide how to eat your single-bowl (no refill) order.    instead of following this custom, yc's prohibits "sharing"  not only does their large chalkboard announce this prohibition upon entering, it also says "TELL THEM TO GET THEIR OWN!"  i would never be so rude to my date.  for $10.95 for one bowl (this perhaps the highest priced mongolian grill i have seen) i should be able to "share"  i questioned the cashier about this policy and was told "our sales are based on the number of bowls we can sell to our customers..so we don't allow sharing"  amazing...  you can, however, get the portion to go...  so, we had to get the portion to go and eat it outside and away from the yc's.   please take down your rude message (and lower your price) or i'll never return.

I am a big fan of YC's! I love the wide variety of options for your bowl and the wonderful sauce options. I particularly like the soups, rice and chips with sweet and sour sauce!! I could eat bowl after bowl of those chips with sauce!!! I am literally getting hungry as I write this review...  I didn't give YC's 5 stars for 2 reasons. 1 is that their prices keep going up. I swear everytime I go the price for a bowl has gone up. I think the last time I was there for dinner a bowl was $11.50. The other reason is that you have to pay for a to-go box!! I think that is a total rip off!!!  Other than that, YC's is great and delicious. I would recommend for a filling lunch or dinner.

I've been eating at this location for years. The staff have always been helpful and friendly. As much as I enjoy eating my food there, I enjoy it even more as cold leftovers the next day once the spice has fully settled into the meat. Well worth what you pay for. With the to-go box (sometimes I need two for my leftovers), I can get between 2-4 meals out of one trip here. The food quality is also good for the price and the flavor is up to you, so if you don't like the flavor, it's more on you than on them. Overall, this is a place I'd recommend.
The food is yummy and I would come back just for the exceptionally friendly and helpful service! Great place to be gluten free and kid friendly.

When I was the young age of 3, my mom brought me to YC's. I have been going ever since. This place is such a pleasant change from all the typical restaurants where you sit down, order from a set menu, and then get served your meal. Here you get to branch out and build your own Mongolian stir-fry from a huge selection of raw ingredients from the buffet style food line. There's meat, tons of vegetable selections, other toppings, and various types of noodles to add. But the personalization doesn't stop there. You then get to create your own sauce either on your own or using any of YC's own personal recipes. At this point, you hand over your bowl to one of their "grill warriors" and watch them bring your stir-fry to life on the giant grills. The finished product always is perfectly cooked, has epic taste and flavor because it has EXACTLY what you want, and keeps you coming back! YC's also has crispy wontons, rice, and chopsticks (of course) to complete the meal! This is a place I will never get tired of because the possibilities are endless. Their facility is always clean and staff is welcoming and helpful. Not to mention, it is very affordable. I highly recommend everyone to "mongo" at YC's Mongolian Grill!

I have come here several times and have never been disappointed. The food is fresh and just incredible. The place is clean and the staff is friendly. If you want a good Mongolian grill this place is perfect. Good price and great food. Highly recommend!!

What do you expect from a Mongolian grill? If I go a Mongolian grill, I am looking for lamb. But they don't have it. So without lamb, a small bowl over 10 with tax is overprice for me. Drinks, rice and soup are free. But rice and soup taste so crap. I guess if you put all meat and press them very dense in a bowl, then you will feel it's worthy. ( I saw a guy was doing that...) But I was there for more veggie.  The food is fresh, but lack of flavor. Although they put the recipes on the wall, it's still lack of flavor. I have to add more chili and soy sauce after I taste it, but it doesn't have the flavor.   The service is great, very friendly. Location and parking is very convenient.

My first time here and it was really good. The sauces and food are very fresh! The only downside is the $1.00 for some take out boxes because if you can eat the whole meal then I am impressed. Also once You pick out your food you watch them cook it, cool idea.

You all know what to expect from Mongolian right?  I mean there are a million reviews below me carefully articulating how you can load up your bowls like it's the Cove of Corruption for shameless gluttoners or gluttonees ...so why this review?  Well...while every other Mongolian grill out there is looking to compete via different sauces, meat over ice instead of frozen, or who's grill stick is longer, YC's decided to take it old school with some good ol' customer service.  This isn't just a customer service experience, these people have it down.  They offer what they can instead of wasting time explaining what they can't, they make an effort to say hello and goodbye, and the best part? It's not overbearing either. Let's just say even if you hypothetically brought someone from the complain capital of the world (Boston) the complaint box would be empty.  /rant  YC ftw!  Btw, isn't Mongolia a starving nation whose citizens can't  even afford the luxury of a grill, much less a tower of meat and uncooked noodles? Irony...at least we know it tastes sweet.
Where do I begin. An inspiration. So good. Staff here is always great and the food never disappoints. Highly recommend!

Add then smoosh.  Add then smoosh.  Add then smoosh.  I have seen this type of grilling in the mall before but never actually felt the urge to dine there. I came here with friends who walked me through the experience. First of all, it is a stand alone restaurant. When you enter the door you pay $9 for the bowl and $0.50 for a togo box for your leftovers.  For the quality of food,  I think $9 is over-priced.  You are really paying a premium for the "experience" of watching someone sloosh around your food on a grill.  It is the express version of benihana.  You walk up to a buffet line and the first thing you see is a box of wax paper.  Those little squares they use when you get donuts.  You grab a couple sheets and proceed to the assorted meats (chicken, beef, pork) and a white fish (cod??) which were all frozen. These items are usually used for chinese hot pots. The quality is mediocre. Next in line are assorted veggies, tofu, and then an array of sauces.  You pick and choose.  As you fill up the bowl, people are using those wax sheets to moosh down the food to maximize space.  Add an item then smoosh.  Repeat.  The meal comes with soda, soup, rice, and frozen yogurt machine.  The best part of the meal was the service.  They are continually replenishing the ingredients and ensuring a cleaning station.  The cashier walked around to check on everyone's meal.  She even offered someone a new bowl since they didn't care for their creation.  That is service!  So even though the food was eh, the service made up for it.

YC'S is just wonderful. I have been going here for years & was so excited when they opened the Germann location! I recommend creating your own sauce & adding lots of their yummy tofu. Also- be sure to pile your noodles on very high!

The Ycs format for you to select the content (meat, veggies, noodles) and then the sauce elements can seem intimidating to folks that are cooking challenged.    The folks will be very happy to assist you with the selections.  It is very easy and fast.  They like you to load up your bowl (press it down with all your strength).  The flat round cooking surfaces that they cook on are very hot....thus you food will be very hot. Your finished dish comes in a bowl, then to the small buffet for rice(Brown or white), soup, and crispy noodles.  Do not let the size of the bowl fool you, if you have an extra moment watch the experts in front of you.  My wife has never been one to eat Asian chow, we now visit YCs 2 times a week.  We end up taking home half for a second meal.

This place is a definite worth while visit and eatery. Choose from unlimited meats, veggies, noodles and sauce, take it the grill and magic happens. There also an ice team dispenser. My all-time favorite place. Highly recommend for those Mongolian grill lovers.

Today was my first visit to YC'S Mongolian Grill and I had a great experience. I walked in and was greeted by Maria and when asked if I had ever been here before I explained that I hadn't.  Maria then walked me through the process and made sure that I had everthing that I needed.  Unfortunately I found a hair in my food but Maria came by and appoligized for the hair and asked me I wanted to start over.  End of story, right. Wrong, Maria brought me a card for a free meal and when I explained that I didn't need that and wasn't looking for that she told me that was exactly why she gave it to me. I will be visiting here again, and the food was great!!!!!

make your own! mix beef chicken and noodles and a few veggies! and then create your very own flavor!.   i get the large bowl and a to go box. fill it with beef and push it down with the wax paper. and keep stuffing meat in to the top. the pile on some veggies and pile up a huge mound of noodles! my bowl sits aleast 12-16 inches high!! but the key is to go and grab another lg bowl up where they make your food! this bowl you fill with your own sauce!! then hand them both bowls and its on!!! if you do it the way i said you will have a bowl and a to box filled to the rim! and eat it all day lol

This place is great.  I like how the chicken was cut in very thin....shaved flakes?  Anyways, I liked the thinness and I didn't have any qualms that it wasn't cooked enough or anything.  Tons of veggie options, and the girl working was so helpful when it came time to pick out the sauce.  The chef's favorite or YC sauce is pretty good.  Nice all around sauce, not too off the wall but still a good mix of sweet and sour and teriyaki.  I like both, so it was perfect.  The win tonight chips and ice cream cones are an added bonus!

I eat here all the time. If you want fresh, healthy food...this is the place. It's always clean. It's fun stacking your bowl high and watching them cook it in front of you. Here's a tip to maximize your bowl space - after you smash the meat slide it up on the side of the bowl so your veggies don't fall off. Also, mix your sauce in a separate bowl. Last thing, you can ask the chef to cook your food longer on the grill or not add so much water or whatever your preference is to really customize your meal.

This is my spot when I am extremely hungry, want something quick but still sit down, and want something with noodles. I went here for about 3 years of my 4 years living in Arizona and it never seemed to disappoint. The service is always fast, and friendly so it made me come back. The food is awesome and the sauce mixing is interesting because you can really become very creative with what you choose as your ingredients to add to make your sauce.  I find the food here to have a lot of flavor, the sauces unique, and the setting inside is a standard set up with booths/ dinning tables around the restaurant. If you are looking for something a little more formal this is not the spot to-go but for a quicker bite on a budget but hungry it is perfect. The price is appealing, the food is excellent, the set up is casual so it is hard for me to say anything negative. It is one of the places I truly miss now that I am no longer in Arizona!
Great service - super helpful staff from beginning to end.  I think I was asked at least 5 times if I need anything.  The food was good and the options were great
Kinda pricey but you determine how much food you get; and you can get a ton if you really stuff the bowl so it's worth it

I love the premise of Mongolian grills, but this one was just ok. I have definitely had better, and think that the placement of the sauce combination cheat sheet could have been better. (I didn't see it until I had already handed over my bowl for grilling). Having been to other Mongolian grills, I was able to put together something tasty, but if I had actually gone by the sauce guideline board, I would have felt comfortable trying something different. I went with veggie-only because I wasn't all that impressed with the meat presentation. The meal was alright, nothing spectacular and nothing foul. I'd give it a C-.

This is a great YC's, their service and management were great! We came in with a ton of kids after a movie and we were taken care of so well.  I love the selection and quality and their sauces are the best, way better than any other MG in the valley.  The chef's soup was out of this world, through a few wontons on it, dang! Thats whatsup!
I'm Asian so I guess my expectation is a tad higher. The customer service was awesome!! The noodle was kinda bland but I loved that chicken vegetable soup.

I've been having lunch here for 6 years now, sometimes several times a week! Although I don't enjoy the constant price hikes or the awkward POS system that makes you feel guilty for not tipping, I absolutely love the food and the staff. In particular Myrra! Easily one of the nicest people I've ever met... anywhere!   Thanks YC'S!

This is my daughters favorite place to eat when she comes to visit from CA. I brought her here a few years ago and she loves it! Their prices are fair. They have a wide variety of veggies and protein. We always leave satisfied.

My sis and I took the parental units to lunch yesterday, and dad was curious about this Mongolian Grill stuff.  This location is in the Supertarget shopping center in the corner by Radio Shack.  Parking close the location is limited, but the large parking lot for Target is right there.    When you enter, you pay up front for a kids, small, or large bowl.  Large is $9 and comes with entree, drink, soup, rice (white and/or brown), wonton chips and dip, and @ dinner you get soft serve ice cream (lunch time, it will cost you $1).   So you go down the line choosing your meats, veggies, noodles, and finally a recipe for your sauce.  The employees have been available and very helpful each time we come here.   They even put my parents sauce recipe together for them.  At the end of the line, cooks fry up your concoction on round hot grills.    Suggestion:  if you like a lot of meat, grab a bunch and smoosh it down with the wax paper.  The meat cooks up really small because it is cut so thin.  Don't be afraid to pile on the veggies and noodles.  And ask questions to find out which sauce you might like; there is everything from sweet to savory to spicy.    Be prepared to take a doggy bag home, but they do charge 50 cents for one.  The good thing is this food warms up so well in a sautee pan the next day!  The favors have time to blend together and makes it even tastier!  This place has the added benefit that you know EXACTLY what you are putting in your entree, so you know what you are eating.

Do you like fresh veggies?  Do you like your meat cooked on a mongolian grill?  Do you like to experiment with your type of sauces?  Then YC's Mongolian Grill is just for you!!  I love this place! I have been a fan for many years, and now it's just right around the corner from my office, making it another fast lunch time place!  For this trip , I grabbed a large bowl and a to go box, put some beef in the bottle of the bowl, hit it with some great looking veggies, didn't skimp on the mushrooms or onions either, piled on the wheat noodles, drizzled some hot chili oil on top, sprinkled some cilantro and pineapples on it, in a smaller bowl hooked me up some spicy Hunan sauce (which I make a tab bit more spicier than whats on the overhead menu, gave it to the guy and watch the magic happen while my lunch was being prepared! Walked to the side, grabbed a bowl of brown rice and some fried won tons & sweet sour sauce!   At this point, I halved my rice & bowl of food into the to go box to make sure I have lunch for tomorrow and lunch for today! Can't beat that! 2 meals, one price! Just word of advice, if you think you might need a to go box, get it when you 1st pay, it makes things easier! I promise!  Yum Yum YCs, looking forward to the next time I come back!
You get a lot of food for the price but the restaurant is dirty and they charge you 50 cents for each to-go box.

If you know how to cook, you should have a good time at YC's. Your meal is basically what you make of it, and although the bowl may be on the medium side, you will shortly find that this makes for a huge meal. I could not even finish mine and had leftovers to take home. They encourage you to pile it as high as you can get it, then I added two bowls of sauce, one spicy and one Mongolian and it came out great. Perfectly sauced, and not thin and soupy like some have stated.   The only thing I didn't really like was the frozen fish, it just did not work well with the stir fry. Bonus if you are tired of take-out consisting of mostly bell pepper pieces and not enough meat, you can make your whole bowl consist of meat, sauce, and rice! (Not that I condone such behaviour).  I thought the ice cream was going to be an icy afterthought like most buffets, but it was actually pretty good so I had two like a big pig. I wouldn't call it gourmet but I would call it decent takeout quality.

I have been here for lunch and dinner with the family.  It's very reasonable, considering all the food that you get.  It usually runs a little over 30.00 for the 4 of us, and includes the stir fry, all you can eat soup and rice, fountain drinks or tea and the dinner menu includes ice cream for dessert.  I love that each of us can create our own bowl and include the meats and veggies that we each like.  It is great for our picky kids.

Once again another great experience at YC's. This time I went to the original location in Tempe. While this location is smaller compared to the other locations It still offers the same great food experience. The employees were always making sure the tables were cleaned. Guests were being checked in quickly. It's nice that they ask if you have been Here before. If you haven't been to YC's before  the employees make sure to explain the process and how the sauces work.  Side note I like that you get a separate bowl for the Sauce.  In the past  you had to add it to your full bowl of food before it was cooked.  Make sure to check out the soups and ice cream. The ice cream is free  during dinner. For lunch there is a fee. Doggy boxes also cost .50 so just buy one when you pay for your food. You will need it.

Been coming here for years! I love that you can build your own bowl. They offer lunch and dinner prices. For dinner the yogurt is included. This location is always clean. The staff is nice and they always greet you at the door. The line where you build your bowl is always tidy and looks pretty. The staff is always monitoring it to make sure everything looks good. The grill is always hot and they clean it often. So no old caked on burnt food from 2 hours ago. They offer doggie bags for .50. Trust me it tastes even better the next day too. Definitely a place that will fill you up.

What can I  say. The food is so delicious. I really like how you can go  to any YC's location and you will always get good food. Plus the restaurant is always clean. I really appreciate the high standards this restaurant sets. Everything is explained so if you are new to YC's you will know how the process works. But never be afraid to ask for help. The staff is so helpful. Plus they want to help. They have lunch and dinner service. Just know that the prices are different. I like going during dinner time because I can add the baby corn in my dish.  There are so many different sauce flavors to choose from. I always go with the teriyaki flavor. Don't forget the ice cream they offer with your meal!

This restaurant reminds my husband and I of a Mongolian barbecue restaurant we use to frequent when we lived in Vancouver, Washington back in 2002.  This restaurant serves up a delightful array of proteins, vegetables, noodles, sauces, dry rubs, rice and fried won ton with sauces. You go down the line and build a bowl--large or small that you are handed at the register where you pay for the bowls. The meal includes a drink. There is huge grill where it's all cooked together. At the end by the grill there is brown and white rice, wontons and sweet and sour sauce for the won tons. Our waitress gave us each a cup to put frozen yogurt in as a treat from her. She was very friendly, welcoming and  nice. (The frozen yogurt is an extra $1.00 if you want to add it on to your meal). Our meal was delicious, hot and fresh. We enjoyed eating here. We will definitely be back.

They have great food and it's really fun to make.  They have large portions and great ice cream, unlimited delicious soup, chips, and all around great service!  Only complaint is that the ice cream machine is only open during dinner :(

I'm really bummed, Yelpers.  I spent a solid 8 years in New York City where, shockingly, they don't have Mongolian BBQ of any kind.  I might as well ask for a unicorn as much as ask someone for Mongolian BBQ.  Growing up, we used to go to this exceptional place in Virginia Beach called the Genghis Khan that was the benchmark for all of my subsequent mongolian BBQ experiences.  It was all you can eat, fresh, tasty and came with delicious soup and this crazy homemade sesame bread (I know - sounds weird from an Asian restaurant, but this bread recipe was super authentic to the region, apparently).  Long story short, my idea of Mongolian BBQ is apparently a far cry from YC's.  Don't get me wrong - the meat and veggies are fresh, the place is super clean and the service is quick.  But shouldn't all of that be a given?  The myriad sauce options are a bit overwhelming if you don't know what you're doing (I was ok saucing for myself, but my husband was confused - good places have a person whom you tell how you'd like it and then sauce for you).  Since the place isn't all you can eat, if you mess up your sauce on the first go, you're stuck with your dish.  Major bummer.  In addition, the whole concept of cramming as much food into a bowl as possible with wax paper and strategizing on how to get the most bang for your buck is really off-putting.  Shouldn't you be able to try different things, graze and casually eat without having to think out your choices like a friggin' game of chess?  Or have to worry about getting a doggie bag for later?  YC's should be a game show the way people scramble to fit as much as they can in a bowl.  The soups are odd - seemingly leftovers from the buffet mixed with broth and then called "wonton" or "spicy beef".  The crispy noodles were stale and tasted of used oil.  We didn't even bother with the frozen yogurt.  A friend who's lived here all his life heard of my search for good Mongolian BBQ and responded "Why?  It's horrible."  I was kind of shocked given that a) he's a good eater and food critic and b) all of my collective experience having Mongolian BBQ up to my going to YC's had been so very good.  I just didn't understand.  Now I'm wondering if YC's is the area's benchmark for which all Mongolian BBQ should be compared to, maybe I should just give up.  It's just not that good at all, and this coming from the girl who'd break off both sets of arms and legs to have even a decent bowl of Mongolian BBQ at this point.  No fair, YC's. No fair.

Love this place. Gone here for years, as a casual lunch w/my dad.  Easy place to hangout w/free refills on soda/tea & soup/rice.  It's worth it to pay a few bucks for a to-go box.  Leftovers=another whole meal!

I love me some Mongolian barbeque!   Real Mongolian though. This is very very close. But for some odd reason it never comes out as mouthwatering as the ones from the buffets do when its cheaper too!  So every time i go to a YCS (which is not usual now) at the back of my mind as i am eating i think why did i come here this is so expensive for something that isn't as great as another place that is 2-4 dollars less for all you can eat?! YCS even charges for a to go box REALLY?! REALLY YCS?? You want to charge me because i actually got somewhat full? You can expect my presence to be scarce! It is a disappointment to me really. I would rather pay for all you can eat with mouth watering quality Mongolian than someone who charges for every little thing. What are you gonna do next YCS? charge for a ladle of soy sauce?! Jiminey Christmas!   UGH
One of my favorite places in Arizona! I come here every time I'm in Arizona!! Tons of options and love the wheat noddles!!!

came in and all the staff had huge smiles and was so kind every time i get something different  love this place used to eat here 3 to 4 times a week  now its once a month wish i could come here more but that's how life happens

This place is good but has gotten way too expensive.  We had a small bowl and large bowl which came to about $26. They even charge for take home boxes which is a gimmick because you're most likely not going to finish your food.

First, I want to thank the owners of this location for an amazing deal.  My husband and I recently moved to the area and received a coupon in a 'Welcome Wagon' type package.  We had never been to YC's and may or may not have stopped in but with the coupon we figured we would give it a try.  We were so amazed and pleasantly surprised.  The food was exceptional and the gal that helped us was so sweet and answered our questions.  Since it was our first time in, we weren't sure how things worked, she patiently explained and helped us out.  After we had sat down with our food and were eating she came by to check on us.  Everything was delicious and we will be back many many times.  The value for what you get is amazing.  Thank you for a great experience with food and service!

Great place for Mongolian bbq. Pick the meat, noodles, veggies, & sauces. Fill your bowl over the top & watch them cook it. White & brown rice, 2 types of soup & wonton chips. You can get at least 2 meals out of it if you set it up right

I have loved this place for as long as I can remember.  I mean, I even gave it it's own nickname: Mongo.  I can always tell when amateurs are in line, because they don't quite know how to smash the meat and other ingredients down to make the largest bowl of noodle goodness as humanly possible.  I know the recipe for my favorite Mongolian sauce by heart and I will drive many miles just to taste those warm noodles.  I know there used to be a few more choices of veggies and things on the line, but after talking to a manager, he told us about their rising food cost which caused them to have to take away some of the things that were previously offered.  Hey, you gotta do what you gotta do to keep costs under control.

This is one of the BEST places in the valley! It's been around for years, the ambiance is cool, family friendly, you can get it for take out, or dine in & either way you're gonna leave happy! The food is just so good!  Another AZ necessity, hands down

i've been going here for years.  i've tried other places like this, but none of them add up. if you go at lunch, you can get 2 or 3 meals for 8$!  it also includes rice, crispy things, soup and a drink.  and then you don't have to eat the rest of the day. :) over time, i've created my own sauce.  the suggestions they give you are helpful, but its good to be creative and figure out what you like. you can get to-go boxes for $.50 and definitely worth it.  the only time you can't get one is with all you can eat option.  i can't understand why anyone would do that, i can hardly finish 1/3 of a bowl.

I've been bugging my boyfriend for months now to try out one of these locations. So happy we finally went. The service was good, good price, great selection. Didn't take long for the food to be cooked while we waited. Place was kept up and clean. My boyfriend said the cod was the best and next time that's all he's getting. Can't wait to go back.

It's definitely a restaurant that's worth the money! Always remember to get a box to go because you will not finish if you pile your bowl like a pro. I love the extras they give you at the end to put on top of your completed bowl. Great place to eat!!

My sister and I wanted to try something new but we were very unsure what we were wanting so we thought we'd go with the whole Mongolian "let's see them cook in front of us" place. I yelped here and there and noticed this place has extensive reviews. 4 stars with lots of reviews is hard to come by now days.   We walk in and we bypass the register so the lady immediately followed us and asked if it were our first time (clearly).  They have an option of bowls but there is only a dollar difference between small and large (we went with large).   You start by selecting the food you want from a small bar with numerous amounts of meats and vegetables. After that you get to pick your own seasonings that'll highlight your dish. The person at the register helps you with all of these options and is really helpful. After all your desires have been chosen you get to see the cook, cook your meal in front of you.   Along with the meal you get to pick up rice and soup with a drink (if you have gotten the meal). Which is a pretty sweet deal. After  our meal (which we didn't finish) we asked for to-go boxes which you have to pay fifty cents extra but with this being our first time she let us have them for free.   Overall experience was amazing. We definitely will be coming back but with empty stomachs. ;)

I was so happy to find a very good Mongolian BBQ because they are rare. The vegis are fresh, sauces are very delicious. My second time there they were extremely busy and the food piled around the grills was disgusting and wasteful. Staff is very friendly and helpful, could not ask for better people. I could not help but wonder since the sauces and every bin was so deep that how often they are changed or is fresh constantly piled on top. Food is still wonderful! The not so Yum is the frozen dessert, it has a very weird taste to it and I skipped it second time there, that is how nasty it tastes. Other places have dairy free and cones. Maybe this has some strange ingredient that I cannot choke down which is rare also.

YC's makes me happy. It will make you happy too. I've been a customer for 25+ years. The joy began at this very location, McClintock and Southern... this loc is the OG baby! Now the romance continues at the, more convenient, Power and Ray location. The quality is the same at each location... I know... I'm experienced.  Tasty, healthy, fun.  When I go I make certain I will have leftovers for the next few days. I am a YC's stacking engineer, Jedi level. I'm not going to detail my process, but the order and compaction of the foods you add to your bowl are key to maximizing your leftovers.  My YC's sauce preference: 4 ladles of YC's own 2 ladles of Spicy Hunan 2 ladles of Ginger 2 ladles of Garlic 3 seconds of Sesame Oil 8+ seconds of Chili Oil A generous amount of Sesame Seeds  Build your own joy. Go to YC's and be happy.

YC's makes me happy. It will make you happy too. I've been a customer for 25+ years. The joy began at the McClintock and Southern location... the romance continues at this, more convenient, location. The quality is the same at each location... I know... I'm experienced.  Tasty, healthy, fun.   When I go I make certain I will have leftovers for the next few days. I am a YC's stacking engineer, Jedi level. I'm not going to detail my process, but the order and compaction of the foods you add to your bowl are key to maximizing your leftovers.  My YC's sauce preference:  4 ladles of YC's own  2 ladles of Spicy Hunan  2 ladles of Ginger  2 ladles of Garlic  3 seconds of Sesame Oil  8+ seconds of Chili Oil  A generous amount of Sesame Seeds  Build your own joy. Go to YC's and be happy.

First time visiting YC's on a recommendation from my daughter. I really really liked it because I could make my own bowl of whatever it is I wanted in there. The meat selection looked weird because its very thin shaved meat but I can do without the meat. The variety of sauces was great and you can even come up with your own sauce. The young lady at the counter was very nice and helpful after I told her that it was our 1st time there. She walked us thru the whole build our bowl process and even helped with our sauce selection. Without her help we would have been lost. We will definitely come back

I would like to say that the owner/manager does know how to run a business and make right on misunderstandings. My kids love this place and always have a great time putting together their own specialized meal! The portions are huge and very delicious!
Cool concept. Prices are great. I will be back. Only thing I didn't understand is why they charge for Togo boxes.

People with food allergies unite! There is finally a restaurant that understands us! I simply cannot say enough good things about this place or their staff.  My wife likes Asian food cannot eat most of it due to being allergic to ginger, mushrooms, and honey.  When we walked in, it was clear that we were new to the restaurant. An employee walked us through the process and asked about food allergies up front. When my wife explained her allergies the employee went through the line, item by item, and told her what she could eat and could not eat.  That was a huge help and welcome change.   Additionally, when you tell them that you have food allergies they give you a little placard to put on your tray and the person on the grill cleans before putting your food on and will not make any other foods on it until yours is done.   At YC's you actually assemble your sauces yourself from a few items they have available and they provide a breakdown on how to make the sauce. For example, for an orange chicken sauce it is 4 scoops of orange, 1 of garlic, 1 ginger, and 1 cooking wine.  In my wife's case, she is allergic to ginger so she got to leave that out. Done.   The prices a reasonable, the portion sizes are huge, the staff are super helpful, it's quick, and the food is good.   The only complaint I have is that is the soup is WAY WAY WAY too salty. It's completely inedible and I hope they fix that.  However, the customer service was so wonderful for a couple with allergies that I don't care and that it will not impact this 5 star rating.

This place is great! They have allot of veggie options and three different noodle types. Your order comes with a drink, soup and rice. The staff is very friendly and they have allot of sauce option. They also give you a separate sauce bowl. I love that they have four fresh brewed tea options!!!

I found Y.C.'s Mongolian BBQ to be decent, but not great. I'd go back, but it wouldn't be my first choice. That said, it's pretty good for Asian food in the greater Phoenix area. I've noticed a trend when it comes to people rating Asian food on Yelp! Those people from the area seem to rate the food much better than those people that are transplants. I was excited to try this place because it was a "mongolian bbq," however it doesn't hold a candle to the B.D.'s Mongolian BBQ in Royal Oak, MI where I'm originally from.

I just love this place. Every time you go you can put a new twist on your meal by changing up the make-up of your sauce.   I always get a small bowl. You can still get way too much food and save money all at the same time.

First time at YC's, had been to other Mongolian BBQ style places, none as "upscale" as this. Most of the Mongo places I've been are in the mall fast food court, or in a small strip mall. This place made us go WOW as to how big it was and all the food you get for about $11 a person for dinner.  To go boxes are 50 cents, super reasonable considering you can really cram a lot of food into your bowl to get cooked. I was actually shocked that they suggested you pack the food into your bowl to get more space! Staff was friendly and even helped us out with mixing the sauces.  This place is super close to our house and we will definitely be back frequently.

Still one of my favorite places to go to eat. You put whatever you want into a bowl and it is cooked to your liking!  What could be bad here?  Well.... their prices!  As I mentioned a few years ago their prices constantly raise, and nothing has changed!  Their prices are borderline ridiculous, I hope they slow down, because they are going to potentially lose a lot of customers!  This place is really becoming very, very $$$$$

I absolutely love coming here, I have been to other DIY style restaurants and those usually make you pay per the weight of the food. I love that you can get as much or as little food as you want for the same price. I always cram my bowl as full as possible and get a take out box so I can enjoy my stir fry leftovers later on. The staff are always attentive and have no problem helping you out if you are unsure of what sauce to mix up. The restaurant is always clean and the food is always fresh. There are few restaurants that I would rate 5 stars, but I can't say enough good things about this place. I will be a customer for life!

This place is great! You fill your bowl with raw meat, vegetables, noodles and sauce - they cook it for you, and you can fill up on sides like soup, rice, crispy wonton chips and more! Location isn't great, and the dining room is a tight squeeze, but the staff is great and more than willing to help out with whatever you need! Be sure to go at dinner for the "prime" offerings!

Holy Cow!  I am so impressed.  They have Mongolian down to an art form.  When I walked in, I explained that it was our first time there.  She explained how everything worked and even told us that for .50 extra we could take our food home in a to go box.  I was super excited because most of the time, my eyes are bigger than my stomach and I end up wasting half my meal.    The food was super fresh and delicious.  They even have someone to help you get the right sauce combination to ensure that your meal is done exactly right.  Rice and soup is included in your dinner.  Still hungry after?  They have frozen yogurt to satisfy your sweet tooth.  My family loves this place and we will definitely be back as often as possible.  SO HAPPY!!!!
Great food, manager on duty was excellent. Place was clean and it was a nice atmosphere.  This is one of our favorite places to go. Definitely recommend.

Gotta say if I didn't have my older sister with me who's been here before, I wouldn't have know all the little secrets about getting more food for your money. Loved the white chicken meat, and loaded up with plenty of veggies. I chose the teriyaki sauce, and I am glad that I did. It was fantastic. I was impressed by the way that it was prepared. The food was fresh and delicious, and a small was very feeling. Plenty to choose from when it comes to combination of foods and sauces. I am looking forward to coming again, and trying something new! Thanks sis for a new favorite place added to the list.

I've got a broken ankle so I'm staring at my walls for way too many hours each day. My sweetheart's been concerned for his safety so he's getting me out & about at least once a week. We (*I*) decided we should start trying out new places for food.  Last night he asks if I've ever been to a YC's. He'd been to one in CA years ago. I hadn't, so I checked out the reviews here, liked what I saw (especially the fact they were still open... Sunday night & I was starved!). Also found out it's less than a mile from home so even better... food... NOW!!  ** THE SERVICE **  Went in on crutches & the gal asked if we'd been there before... no, we haven't. We ordered 2 large bowls. She explained how it all works, even showed us how (& encouraged us) to smash as much food as we can into the silver bowls.   When we got to the spices, she came back & explained the menu board (if you find a mixture you like, you can repeat it the next time), asked me what flavors I preferred, & proceeded to help me (I told her what I liked... she put it in the bowl).  Once I had my all my ingredients, she carried my tray to the grill area for me & went back to help my man navigate the spices.  The guy at the grill tossed everything on top & started mixing it all together. It's always fun to me when I get to watch people cook my food!! I get to see how it's done (I suck as a cook but it's nice to know it CAN be easy!) & I know exactly where my food's been before I start eating... a win-win in my book!  In less than 4 minutes, I had a huge bowl of piping hot Asian food in front of me!! The nice gal came back & carried it to my table, got me 2 bowls of rice, a cup of iced tea, & an extra one for refills so I wouldn't have to have my man chase down more for a while.  NOTE: Don't expect this type of service!! As I said, I went in on crutches. Even then, I was still amazed at the extra help. I loved it because my man didn't have to keep interrupting his meal to make sure I had what I needed!!  ** THE FOOD ** I just can't say enough. The food is super fresh. The meats are shaved so you're not dealing with the chance of fat/grissle/ick that you sometimes run into at Asian food restaurants (yep, that'll ruin meals for me). You pick exactly the veggies you like (this is the first time EVER that I've had Asian food & haven't had to pick thru my food & end up throwing away half my meal!!).  AND, you get exactly the flavors & heat level you want. We're both super spicy people. But no matter where we order "extra spicy", we just don't get it. That didn't happen here! We both used the chili oil to what she called a "level 8" & you could actually taste the spice (next time I'm sure we'll be doing a 9 or 10, but it was really good at the 8 too).  ** PORTIONS ** I thought we'd done a good job at stuffing our bowls. But after seeing what others were doing, I know we can do better next time! LOL  But even with what we did, the bowls were full. He ate all of his... he's one of those guys who likes to feel full when he goes out & he was more than full when he finished. I ate about a third of my bowl & brought home leftovers that'll be good for another 2 meals for me!  They offer both brown & white rice. They have soup which I can't comment on since neither of us had any. And they have soft serve ice cream if you save room for dessert (how can you NOT save room for ice cream?!?). I got the twist kind with one of those tiny cones... VERY good!  ** CLEANLINESS ** The place was super clean. One of the gals was training a new gal & was literally wiping down ALL the walls. The tables were all clean. The guy at the grill was constantly cleaning the cooking area between customers. Everything you want in a food place!  ** PRICES ** Between the 2 bowls & the tip, we paid $30 for dinner. When I asked the gal for a takeout box, she let me know they normally charge 50 cents for them, but since it was our first time (so I didn't know to ask), she gave me one. For the amount of food, I'll pay the 50 cents!  We saw on the way out that we could get "Unlimited" for $1 more. We'll do that next time so he can have leftovers too!!  ** SIDE NOTE ** I asked my son this morning if he'd ever been to a YC's. He likes Asian food, but he's a super picky eater (aka doesn't eat any vegetables). So I figured it'd be an awesome place for him to go since he can pick and choose what's in his meal.   His text back to me? "It's f***in' amazing!" Really? He knew about this place and didn't tell me? I fired him as my food advisor!!  ** BOTTOM LINE **  We will definitely be going back soon!!

The people here are super friendly. They definitely will help you out on how to make sauces and also any other questions you might have. I'm just a little surprised on how expensive YC is now. I haven't been here for years, so I'm not too surprised now. The only thing that kind of irks me is that they charge you 50 cents for a to-go box and it's not even the super big boxes, it's the small one like for Chinese takeout. That makes me force to eat everything on my plate and I would have love leftover Chinese food for the next day. Other than that, the food is still good.
While the food tasted good, my date and I BOTH walked away with food poisoning from here on Sunday, June 24th.  So that was awesome.

YC's is Yummy! Choose whatever you want for meats and veggies, then whatever combination of sauce you want on it, and they wok it up for you! I always buy a to-go container for 50 cents because it is a small price to pay for another meal and I always end up with extra. I recommend the wheat noodles, they are really good. The meal includes crunchy wonton chips with sweet and sour sauce, soup, white or brown rice, and frozen yogurt at the end. Its a good deal for the money! :)

We went here on Valentines Day for a girls night out (being single doesn't mean you have to be miserable!), it was my first time at a YC's! Another friend of mine went to the one on Elliot, and she raved about it to me. I completely forgot until we went here on the 14th!  We arrived before they closed, what's nice is that they let you eat your fill if you don't pull a dick move and arrive at 8:45pm to eat with a large group. I'm not a big fan of buffets, after visiting one with my family in California, I became completely discouraged with the rampant shouting kids, claustrophobic tables and chairs that made you turn sideways to walk down isle, and some of us ended up with food poisoning since the waiters weren't keeping the place clean - but YC's has given me a good outlook on family sit-down buffets. At least, arrive after 8pm so parents have to take the kids home for bed on a weekday haha!  After paying we walked down the line, a lot of people were piling it up, my friend helped me figure it out which was really simple. The girl at the cash register was nice also and helped with the instructions on how to get the food.  One thing I really loved about YC's was that above the area where they fry your food up, there is a huge chalkboard on all the different Asian sauce mixes you can have for your dish! I ended up making Curry-yaki, and it was REALLY good, it reminded me of eating in a Japanese food court while in California!  YC's is a clean place, not loud and obnoxious after 8pm on a weekday, and people are polite while you're waiting for your food in line. I want to try this place out again so you can count on me coming back!!!

Got here around 7pm, the cashier got to us fast, asked if we knew what to do, and we were on or way to snag some yummy Mongolion Grill food!!!  There wasn't a long wait in line to grab food, or a long wait for them to cook your food! The resturaunt is clean, and the interior is roomy and doesn't feel cramped. They have vanilla, chocolate, or the vanilla chocolate swirl froyo in a cup or cone included with your meal.  The on on McClintock can't compare, but they are usually backed up with families. Since this location is a little more "hidden" you can enjoy a quiet night with family or friends while you enjoy your meal :)

I was so excited to finally try the place I ended up being early.  We paid our admission to the food funhouse that is YC's and then got down to business.  Armed with bowls the size of our heads, we stepped to the buffet and I got my first look at what I was up against.  The first third of the buffet is filled with shaved curls of frozen meat in various varieties.  Beef, Chicken, Pork, Alligator and Yak.  Frozen curls of Yak!  Okay so I lied about the Yak and the Alligator.  But you never know.  They SAID it was beef and chicken, but seriously, it could have been Yak!  I grabbed the tongs and threw a pile of meat in the bottom of my bowl.  I smiled at my accomplishment but she just looked over slightly concerned and then handed me a sheet of wax paper.  "You need to smash it down." she said.  "What?" I replied? "The meat," she explaind patiently.  "You need to smash it into the bottom of your bowl."  "But I'm not that hungry!" I protested.  "You will be and this is gonna last you for days.  See that guy on the end? Your bowl is supposed to look like that." She pointed towards the end of the buffet where I saw a towering mass of vegetables rising out of an already unfathomably large bowl.  It would easily feed a family of four.  His YC fu was impressive, but I was sure I could top that.  "Get Smushing," she said as I refocused on the task at hand.  After I had pressed all the pretty curls of meat into a flat unrecognizable blob that filled the bottom half of my bowl, we moved onto the vegetables.  If you've had it in "Chinese" food, it was there.  I zeroed in on some celery, cabbage, bean sprouts, carrots, scallions and baby corn.  I piled it on with gluttonous abandon, gleefully shaping my mountain of food to resemble the peak from Close Encounters of the Third Kind.  The last third of the buffet contains sauces.  Many many many sauces.  Get them, they are good.  They have recipes but seriously, who wants to read directions?  I needed more sauce than I took and I thought I took a lot.  It would have helped to know they were going to slap it on a grill and immediately start diluting it with water.  Seriously, I put like five or six scoops of various stuff in and it was still just barely sauced enough.  I supplemented with some spicy mustard.  So um.. then they cooked it, and we ate it.  Sure it was good.  Yes I still have leftovers.  No you can't have them.  Is the food here the best I've ever had? Hell no.  But it's pretty good for fast/cheap/healthy-ish stuff and seriously who cares? They let you play with it for like half an hour before you even sit down.  Score!

My man likes it here. This place stresses me out.    If you have never been, you gather your ingredients and bring it to the grill for preparation.  I feel like I'm making a mess, and the bowls aren't big enough. I feel rushed by the people behind me. I can never make the concoction of sauce that tastes good.  Take out is a holy debacle.  If it were up to me, I would pass. But I undoubtedly will be visiting again sometime in the future.
Stepped out side of my comfort zone and tried this with my daughter, I must say it was a pleasant Suprise, great food and very affordable, cooked to order tight in front of you. Will be back

this place is my absolute fav and anytime i'm near it i must stop in...  you can pack so much food into their bowls you seriously have lunch for work for the next three days.  the variety of food changes on a day-to-day basis, so sometimes when i go they don't have my favorite things (baby corn, water chestnuts), but i manage to cram 6 feet of food in my bowl anyways...  their sauce choices are very good and the staff working can usually help you with it as it may get a little confusing...be sure to add lots of chili sauce if you want it hot...  you can also get rice, won tons, soup, and a drink with your dinner..which is a great deal for $10.   if you're seriously stoned, go in. you won't be disappointed. and you won't be able to put your fork down long enough to talk to your friends about it either!!!

I don't like stir fry. This place has completely changed my opinion! My husband drove past this and we stopped out of curiosity. OMG it was absolutely delicious! It is almost like a buffet but it's ONLY stir fry. So you start at the beginning and load up whatever meat, veggies, noodles, etc that you want. You end up at a sauce bar where an employee will most likely help you out. There's like 12 different sauces and a recipe board if you want to follow their mixtures. I recommend the Calcutta Curry. We did the unlimited which was about $15 and we ate roughly 3 bowls each. Then we had soup and finished with some cheesecake frozen yogurt. Absolutely loved the atmosphere, food, and staff here!

There was a place called JP Lee in NJ and we used to eat and I loved it. I thought I would never find it again, but then I did with YC's. Same shit.  Here is a couple of tricks.  Ask for water chestnuts during the day, they will get them from the back. Make the meal so much better.  Here is my Bowl of YC's Krunk Slop that I love:  Pork and Chicken in bowl Cover with onion and one scoop of wine pat down  put veggies on. I go for water chestnuts and Bamboo shoots Then 2 scoops: hunan thai yc's own soy garlic seame oil  sprinkle chili oil  put noodles on top.  (Egg noodles)  do all sauces again.  then put on the flat grill.  Tell them NO WATER.  Water dilutes the sauce and seasoning.    This is a must eat.

This was our first time at YC's and the hostess was very welcoming and helpful. She walked us through the bowl sizes, the food line, and helped me make my sauce as well. There is a board of sauce recipes to follow for the ingredients but for it being our first time it was very helpful that the hostess walked us through it. Once you have your bowl ready you hand it to the cooks and they make it right in front of you. Less than a five minute process depending on how busy it is.   They also have soup and ice cream but if you need a to go box it's an extra charge. Keep them in mind when picking your bowl size.

What an awesome restaurant to enjoy some time with friends or family! The vegetable items are fresh and they have a huge selection. The board of flavors has some wonderful selections and I would recommend the teriyaki sauce flavors. Don't forget the customer service is great! We will continue to drive 40 minutes to this place.

This has been my go to for stir fry for quite a while. The food here is always consistent and the only times it has been more questionable is purely based on my inability to choose the right sauces and ingredients to mix together.

A good place for Chinese Mongolian. You get as much as you can fit in the bowl. So push down hard and squash the meat down into the bowl. Pretty much build your bowl the way you want. You get your money's worth. The price includes meal, drink and ice cream.

I like coming here with a buddy of mine who does it best. He takes the bowl and forces so much meat in the bowl, the cook has to use two bowls after everything expands. I strive to do this one day, not an easy task! Awesome service, really fresh food with so many options!!

The aroma drew me after leaving  the movies.  You get a bowl.  Choose a frozen meat.  Top it with seasoning salt of ur Choosing, veggies add that with a bowl of marinade. Rice or some sort of noodle.  Then u wait,  observe, collect your drink.  Sit and eat.   Then yogurt.  All under 12 bucks.  And so much to take home.  Very pleased with this find!

I was impressed. I love being able to add whatever food I want myself with as much as I can pack into my bowl. They recognized it was my first time there and were helpful explaining how it all works, including help selecting the sauce. The price was a bit high but I was very impressed with the amount of food I got.

Taste was bland!  you are better off going to Genghis Grill instead.  YC's only has 3 meat choices and no seafood!  It was fresh, but flavorless.  You had to get the noodles in your bowl too so you get less here than you do at Genghis Grill.

This place is soooo delicious!!! And fun because you get to put together your own bowl. Fill it up as high as you can but don't let it overflow because they will only cook what is on the bowl. Service is amazing at this location, especially Alex-he's awesome!! Very helpful and friendly :) I highly recommend this place, you really get your money's worth!!!

The food here is amazeballs and the staff is always kind. The only reason I'm not giving this place 5 stars is because they try to charge you extra for take out boxes, and they don't have that listed on the menu and don't mention it to you before you order the large size bowl. WHO DOES THAT?  rude. I already paid $12 for a plate. Next time I'm just going to grab my food by the handful, shove some in my pocket and walk out trailing wheat noodles behind me #nofoodleftbehind
If you don't love YC's then we can't be friends.
Great food you can stuff your bowl as high as you want so come hungry.    They have vegetarian options but didn't care for the end result.   Little costly for Asian food.

Made a road trip from Cali to New Orleans. We were coming back and had to get gas and we were hungry yelped helped us, we were craving tacos and then we saw this place! Once we walked in we were greeted by the prettiest and friendliest girl there! We were also first timers and she explained every step! Which was super helpful! She told us multiple times to fill up our bowl as much as we can lol! She encouraged us to overflow our small bowl. When we got to the sauces she was extremely helpful and asked us what we were craving and what we liked whether it was hot,sweet ,sour or all the above. She explained everything and which was her favorite! But she also recommended the popular one too! Getting to the grill the chef was all smiles and cooked everything in your bowl. Once we got to our table we were ready to eat! Everything was favorable and delicious everything was Cooked! Can't wait to visit Arizona again to come here again!

Stopped in here early on a Saturday morning to grab lunch, and was pleasantly surprised.  The restaurant was clean, and we were greeted by a friendly hostess as soon as we entered.  She was very helpful answering the few questions we had, and then we moved on to the ingredient bar.   All the ingredients looked very appetizing, and the vegetables were fresh and nicely sliced.   They really have a great selection of seasonings and sauces.   16 sauces in all, so you can mix and match to your hearts content and come up with some fun stuff!  The cooking area was very clean, and the cook prepared the food quickly and cooked it just right.  The vegetables were cooked, but still just a bit crisp, and all the meat tender.    There's plenty of brown or white rice to go with the entree as well.   Really a nice place to stop and eat.

First time trying this place and was very impressed. Super friendly and super helpful staff, when they asked if it was our first time there and we answered yes. The staff was super helpful showing us all the options and assisted with us choosing the sauce as well. They answered all our questions and were more than willing to help with any questions we may have had. Most people don't seem to like the.50 for to the Togo boxes, but I fully understand. So many options to choose from, pick your portions and  a great look and feel. Will definitely be back!

Walk in. Pay the cashier roughly $13 a person. Grab a silver bowl, a tray and some paper to mush as many ingredients into said bowl as possible. What the!? Meats include: chicken (white and dark), pork, beef, and a fish option. Maybe I'm forgetting one...? Oh well....move along and shove as many veggies as you can and then smush and stack as many noodles as you can on top. Up next, grab another smaller silver bowl and fill with any kind of sauce creation you could think of. Luckily the staff are ready and willing to help make your sauce. Then carefully waddle over to the cook and watch him "play hockey with your food". That basically means he puts your creation onto a giant, bazillion degree hot surface and uses these paddles to cook it all to perfection. After being amazed by the cooking process, stumble to a table and eat! Also included in the price: soft drinks and iced tea, two kinds of soup with wonton crisps, and white or brown rice. Wait! I forgot there is also chocolate and vanilla ice cream available! Wooo! There is a 50 cent charge for a to go container if you want to take your leftovers. If it's your first time, the container is free.  I will acknowledge that I had an upset tummy after eating here but I'm willing to give it another shot as it could have been unrelated. I wasn't in too much pain....haha
WOW! Food was so good! And you get so much! And extra free sides! What a hook up! Staff is SO nice & friendly too!! Definitely coming back here!!

By far the best experience I've had at any of these types of restaurants. I never feel like I know what to put together, particularly on the sauces. One of the employees here must have picked up on that, because she came over to ask me if I'd like help with the sauce. I said sure and she proceeded to ask questions about what we like. She came up with perfect combinations for me and my son. He ate his entire veggie stir fry, and mine was delicious. She came by while we were eating to make sure we liked them. We came in about an hour before closing and the restaurant was clean, the staff was friendly and I was pleasantly surprised. Hopefully I'll remember her concoction for next time, because we'll definitely be back.

my first time having Mongolian food, I was rather confused as to what to order and what to do. The lady at the register walked me through every step of the way and even made me a bowl of sauce. The place was beautiful, the staff was very nice. Loved it

Very well priced because it includes soup, rice, drink and ice cream.  The food is whatever you make of it. If it tastes, bad, it's your fault. If it's good, it's your credit.  Usually very good. Service is very efficient.

I really like the mixture that I created and love the flavor that I put together in my bowl. Those guys who work at the kitchen they work hard, so I think they deserve some tips.  I noticed some of the customers were being greedy by putting so much food in their bowls and they didn't even finish it, what a waste.  Overall experience was great and yes we will comeback here again.

The food is so fresh and you have sooo many options to customize your own bowl.  If you don't like it its your own fault since you made it lol.  So much food for your buck.  and it can be pretty healthy if you use the fresh veggies and you dont pack your bowl  with all noodles.  Hot tip: add a few shrimp for $1!!  My bf loves it since he is into the whole caveman thing and likes triple meat and they dont have a meat limit or charge extra for it.  Restaurant is always very clean.  Would recommend to everyone.  That whole shopping area is kind of dying out but this is its best kept secret.  Hopefully yc's is here to stay!
Great food and tons of it. The staff was super friendly and helpful. They showed us how to pack the stuff in our bowl down with tissue paper so we could get even more.

Was brought here by a couple of friends who kept raving about the food.  My first and last time.  I begged them to try another place to compare.    The meat resembled rolled up frozen deli meat of poor quality.  Nothing fresh, very tasteless and dry.  The selection of veggies looked sad and very picked-over.  I was disappointed that there was not an option of adding an egg.  And the starch choice was noodles or plain rice, that's all.  Lots of choices of sauces but they still couldn't make it delicious.  But wait...  free frozen yogurt!  I could care less.  I eat at Mongolian grills for the Mongolian, not crappy generic soft serve.  And then to be charged for a to-go box?  That's ridiculous.  I will go to Genghis Grill instead.  Quality trumps quantity any day (not to mention actual service.)  Even the Mongolian Grill at the Banner Desert hospital cafeteria is better as far as taste and quality goes (not to mention WAY cheaper.)

This place is great, all you can eat including a drink and frozen yogurt for $11 is hard to beat.  Everything looked fresh and none of the toppings looked like they had been sitting for more than a few minutes.  Cooking time is short and you can go back as often as possible.  Highly recomend for a quick bite that is good and filling

I have tried every other mongolian bbq in the valley and none compare to YC's. It is just plain better. Price is right for the portion. I pay extra for the box and go nutts at the line and take home the extra. Meat is always the best quality, the veggies are always fresh. Though busy at peak times, they always get you through the line quick.   YC's needs a seafood night with lobster and shrimp etc. I'd pay allot more a coupel times a month to step it up.  As for the frozen yogurt, don't bother. They need to pick up the brand Sweet Tomatoes uses and add a little fixin bar and I would pay the extra for dessert.

I stopped by here this past Wednesday evening with my wife, her parents and her brother for dinner.  The inside of YC's Mongolian looks like like most Mongolian restaurants with a large buffet like bar, a couple of circular grills and then some seating.  How YC's differs from our Mongolian Grills back in Pittsburgh is that their meat is frozen and they also have mixed sauce suggestions.  If you have never been to a Mongolian grill before the premise is simple.  You are given a bowl that you fill up with whatever meats, vegetables and carbs that you want.  Then you pair a sauce with it and it gets cooked on the grill and handed back to you.  On this occasion I went with the unlimited bowl while my wife went with the large bowl.  All of my trips produced very similar items in the fact that I got chicken, beef, water chestnuts, broccoli, cauliflower, bell peppers and pineapple.  The only differences between my bowls were the sauces as I twice went with Thai peanut curry and once missed their spicy sauce all while adding chili oil to each. All three times I ended up enjoying my bowl.  It's nice to be able to customize it to your own personal preferences.  By the time I left the restaurant I was incredibly satisfied and stuffed.  Then within an hour of finishing eating I had some issues and my wife had different issues the next morning.  Can I prove that they were YC's fault?  Nope I cannot, however, I have my suspicions.    The bottom line for me is that I probably wouldn't come to YC's again in the future.  While I was happy and satisfied with the food while I was there, I certainly wasn't later in the evening turning a 4 star review into 3 stars.  UPDATE:  The owner of YC's contacted me on Yelp the day after my review was posted .  He let me know that he was glad that we enjoyed our meal but sorry that we had issues afterward and that they take food safety seriously.  He also gave me a number to contact him.  That alone should show you that the owner does care about his establishment and what goes on their and gives me a much more favorable view of YC's.
Food was amazing. Price was fabulous. Staff was friendly and restaurant was clean. Will be back regularly
Delicious, cheap (for how much you actually get), and oh yeah, delicious.  I LOVE this place. I easily take home enough food for 3 meals. Great variety and nice people.

I love YC's!  This place is great.  While it was slightly confusing my first trip, I quickly caught on.  Pack your bowl with as much meat and veggies as you can.  Use the little paper strips to smash it down and then pile on the noodles, and invent your sauce.  I never go by any of the "recipes" they have listed.  I have fun just making up my own...lol.  The Spicy Beef soup is excellent.     I believe the price is $9 lunch and $10 dinner for which you get a serving of ice cream.   And you will have leftovers so just go ahead and get a to-go box for $.50 more.  My box is always filled to the top as if I hasn't eaten anything, but the reality is that I am stuffed and you just get so much food here.   Oh and it's not just that it's a good deal, the food is actually yummy!
