Comforting questions were asked, such as "have you been here before", "how is everything tasting", and making sure there wasn't anything else we needed. Our server wasn't annoying about it, but it was very polite when he asked and how he asked it. Overall the food tasted really good. You choose yourself exactly what you want to get, so there seems to be little to no chance of disappointment. If you were unsure how to make something you know you'd like, there was a menu with about sixteen different combinations telling you exactly how to make something you might enjoy.   I think the strengths were obvious when going to YC's. All the criteria that I had expected turned out to be better. The environment wasn't how I expected it to be, but that wasn't a bad thing. It was still calm and enjoyable, which is essentially what most people look for when eating out. Like I said before, the food tastes absolutely amazing. It's very different, but it's also definitely satisfying. Overall, it was very enjoyable, and the environment had a lot to do with that. I honestly only have positive things to say about this YC location off of Power road. The service was more polite than expected and I guarantee I'll be back with an attitude looking forward to an experience as great as the last, along with the great food. With the reasonable price for so much of the amazingly delicious mongolian grilled food, I'm positive I'll be back in the near future for more.
The girls are amazing. Great customer service. They are so nice and helpful! On my first time there, they explained how everything works. Cuz I felt really lost! Tasty food!

My family really enjoyed this place and have now gone twice. My daughter has a blast watching the cooks and loves the noodles. My husband and I can make exactly what we want and the little extras like the wontons and soup are just as yummy. We are already planning a trip here soon.
This place was awesome! You go in and select your meat, add your veggies and sauce, and they cook it right in front of you! Smash down the meat, then pile your bowl as high as you can! So fun!

In general I like Mongolian Grill concept restaurants and YC's is no different. First visit was kind of underwhelming but this location has a good vibe, helpful notes and sauce combinations written on a chalkboard and a speedy service which  is hard to beat. However, it fails to excel in any distinguishable way which leaves it firmly in the good but not great category. Everything others have posted in their five star reviews is true, your mileage will depend on how much you value portion size, unlimited drinks, etc. Definitely a solid lunch spot.

Went in today for lunch, seriously haven't been here in forever, same great taste as always. The line was stocked with fresh ingredients, the line was clean and there was a young lady she is always there she must be a manager, she is helpful and will you with your selection if you need it and talk you through the process! I consider myself a pro lol but it was nice to have her help my not so pro friends. Food came out perfectly cooked and dining room was clean. Five min into our meal another young lady checked on us to make sure everything was perfect. It was Delish ! My only one negative would be it was like it's going through a remodel or something there was holes patches every where and stuff moved around! With that being said none of that effected the food or the service ! I'll be back for sure !!!!

Good Mongolian BBQ place albeit on the pricey side at dinner. Lots of add in options as well as sauces to choose from.  Soup and rice could use a little work as well as the desserts. The place is kept clean and the staff is friendly.

This review is long overdue. I've been going to various YC Grill's around the valley for years, but about 4 months ago they blew me out of the water with an idea for a sauce. I walked into the Tempe (Elliott) location after a workout at nearby Jab Fitness.  I wanted to eat healthfully, but the sauces can be so filled with sodium and sugar, I didn't know the best way to go.    I was resigned to just have sugar and salt, when I was asked if I needed help with my sauce.  So, I asked which sauce would best fit my needs.  Once we discovered that most have that sugar and/or sodium component, she said said, "wait, do you like lemon?" Sure! At which point she made up a sauce of lemon, ginger, garlic, wine and chili oil. It was fantastic! Brought out the flavors of the veggies nicely. At that point she told me to just ask for lemon, which is kept in the back...   Since then, I've visited several locations and asked for the "secret sauce" from the back. Without hesitation I always get my lemon.  Get this, a few times they have been out of the lemon, so the squeeze fresh for me! Doesn't get better than fresh.   I frequent the Germann YC's more than the other and they are super helpful and friendly - but they are all great.  Thank you YC Grill!

Went there on Thursday, the service was great. A young lady with glasses was very nice and was very helpful. She helped me pick me certain flavor and gave me lots of suggestions. Can't wait to go back
This place is missing one key ingredient:  Flavor.

When you come here be ready to eat!   For those of you who do not know how this place works....you get a bowl and basically go to a buffet style set up where you pack raw meats and uncooked veggies into your bowl. You can put as much as you want, I wouldn't exactly say fit in your bowl, because the food is always overflowing. Once you have loaded up your bowl you pick the sauce(s) you want to use. There are recipes for different kinds of sauces available for you. After that, your food is cooked infront of you in about 3-5 minutes.   After that you take it to your table and enjoy...I would suggest filling your bowl up with a lot of noodles, even if your bowl is completely filled.
You can't beat the price. Service is efficient. The food is fair. Will I eat here again? Of course, but this place is definitely not in my top ten.

This is the only Mongolian restaurant I've tried, and I enjoy it enough. I always end up with a huge amount of leftovers, after observing some regulars fill their bowls and taking some cues from them. You need to pound the meat down to fill the bowl as it shrinks and comes in these obnoxious curls that take up valuable bowl space. No worries, they put out a bunch of wax paper since it is expected you will do this. They recently added new spices to the meat section which is a nice new addition.   Then you add your vegetables, followed by the two types of noodles - wheat and rice. I like to mix them both in my bowl as they each have different but good flavor. Don't be afraid to pile the noodles high! At the end are the various sauces and a chalkboard overhead gives you suggested recipes. Often times there are employees at the end there to help you tailor your flavors, but after a few goes at it you get the hang of it. Watching them cook on those superheated flat tops, moving the food around with long chopsticks is fun, and the food always comes off steaming hot.   All entrees come with soda, soup, and rice, and dinner entrees come with soft serve ice cream. To-go containers for leftovers are $0.50 extra, but you can order takeout for the regular price and not pay for the containers. If you order takeout, you still can get soda, soup and rice for no extra fee.  My wife, who has experienced more upscale Mongolian restaurants, was a bit disappointed by YC's. If you've had other Mongolian this might not live up to your expectations, but I don't know better so I enjoy it. I was addicted at first, but after a few visits I slowed down to an occasional visit.

I came here tonight with my husband. We were greeted nicely and service was ok.   The food was decent to. When we left a few hours later we both got extreme food poisoning. Like super bad. I won't recommended this to anyone. Glad I don't have to work tomorrow.   Don't come here unless your wanting to call in sick the next day at work.

I am a conservative food person, so "Mongolian grill" is out of my wheel house... but let me tell you... this is a fave! I am a regular here. You can customize every Single time you order to exactly what you want. So yummy! I've finally gotten my sauce to how I like it! And... for those of us who like to be cheap, this is absolutely 2 meals!!

Delicious, hot, affordable and filling!   Pro Tip:  Opt for the dinner sized bowl and also buy a to go container too.  Then cram as much stuff as you can in your silver bowl before they cook it.  Then fill half of the to go container with rice and pour all your leftovers into the take out container when you are done eating.  Viola!  Ready made lunch for tomorrow.  :)
One of my favorite's for over twenty years, they gotta be doing something right. It's a Tempe institution.

Very easy to overeat here if you're not careful. Over time with cooking experience of your own/making your own sauces will help you. Avoid creamy sauces, stick with yc's own and you're pretty much golden. Doggy boxes are .50 but use them because you'll have leftovers. Also load up on the chicken and vegetable soup; it comes with your meal and is pretty filling.

Always very clean, extrememly friendly staff and great food!!!! I'd u haven't been to ycs, its a must!! Staff is always willing to help u make you're own sauce or show u how to make their fav sauces for your bowl. And free ice cream!!! Cmon :)

YC's is a pretty cool place to go.  Here's how it works: you get a bowl and you fill it up with anything you want, including sprouts, broccoli, carrots, onions, peppers, scary dehydrated meat and much more.    After all your ingredients are in your bowl, you then get to choose the sauces you want to put in it.  They have suggestions and recipes for you to follow, from sweet to super spicy. Or you can always make up your own.   Then the chef's wok it up for you and pour it all back into your bowl.  You can add some rice to it, sesame seeds or any other toppings that you want and choose a table to sit at.   My only warning is to vegetarians- you must ask the cook to clean off the grill before cooking yours because if you don't, you will get little pieces of meat in your bowl that have been left on the grill from someone else's meal!

I've been eating here since they opened! Amazing fresh veggies and great flavors. If you master filling your bowl correctly you can eat and take home even more for later. Gotta love having control over every aspect of your meal. The staff are helpful if you are a first timer, so just ask. I love love love YCs!

This is the only reliable Mongolian bbq place I've found locally. This is a great place to go for a quick lunch that's not fast food and not overpriced. For about $7.50, you can get a huge bowl of food, a cup of soup, a drink, and a to go box to take your leftovers with you. I usually get two meals out of one visit here.   The dining area is always clean. Nice outdoor patio.

1st experience here and absolutely loved everything about it! Can't believe I didn't know about this place till now! Friendly staff, clean and comfortable environment. And food was delicious and reasonably priced for the amount you get. Definitely will return :)

I can now say this is my favorite YC's location(inside)! If you've never been here, it's like a build your own bowl... basically stack until you can't stack anymore!  I arrived about 5 minutes before opening and accidentally walked in early, but they welcomed me in... told me to have a seat and get a drink while they checked to make sure the cooks were ready for orders! All the staff were very friendly and helpful if you needed help with the sauces and choosing flavors to mix. The vegetable selection seemed endless and had more variety than any other one I've seen (yum, kale). This may be the first location I have heard one of the cooks hold a conversation as well while making the food. All in all, it was a great filling lunch walking distance from where I was getting my tires worked on.   One complaint I do have is the smell when walking in to the entrance, there is a strong sewage/garbage stench that just lingers... no one wants to smell that before or after they are done with their meal! Until that's fixed, I'm keeping at 4

I always liked this place, making it the way I wanted. My disappointment is how much they raised prices and that they charge for To-go boxes $.50!?! WtH?Why??  Why on earth would you charge for To-go  it's not a buffet bar. It's $13 for lunch then you can't even take your leftovers?  Really horrible policy.

Wow wow wow! A friend recommended I try this place and Wow! I love it! I love how it's buffet style. Plus it comes with soup and amazing wonton chips! Yummy! The staff helped me pick sauces to use and all told me to pack my bowl to the max! The price is about 13.00 but it was worth every penny! I had left overs! It became two meals for the price of one! I will make many trips here. Great concept and great food.

So many options!!! This is definitely my GO TO place!! I love the fact that they let you make it exactly how you want it! Such a great atmosphere and the employees working there are always super duper helpful!! We love YC's!
We tried this place on a whim.  It was excellent!  An extensive selection of fresh veggies and sauces.  We took half home.

Pack a Bowl. Love this place! Super nice staff, the manager always comes by and asks how things are going. Love the price and condiments are plentiful. I always have leftovers and they make for a great meal later that night! Packing a Bowl is an art forum and I have my technique down. Years of practice ya know. You have to crawl before you walk. Get some!

I would be giving this 5 stars. However, they recently switched to Pepsi, and as a pregnant woman, that is a huge deal breaker.  Otherwise, the food is good (love the wonton chips!) and it's clean. The service has always been great and fast.  No complaints other than switching to Pepsi. Why YC's??? WHY??????

A great place to eat, I think you get a lot for your money. You gather up some noodles put what ever you like in there. Pick what kind of flavor you like. But some of the flavors kind of taste the same to me. Oh plus they have chips, rice and soup. I always get all of it, a bowl of chips, a bowl of rice and soup! I get so full eating here, I always have leftovers.

I love YC's! Best place for a huge meal with tons of tasty leftovers. The place is clean and the hostess, while sometimes takes a while to get to the front, is always polite. The food is DELICIOUS and the fact that they give you recipes for the sauces is cool. My food always comes out amazing and the cherry on top is that even though it's not a full sit down restaurant, the hostess still checks on you to make sure your meal is fine.  **just something to mention: the cost for a doggy bag last time I was in was a mere $.50 plus tax and to pay that to have a great lunch the next day is so worth it for sure.

We would have had 5 Stars but what can a veggie eater expect when there is meat in the house.  Yep, I bit into a piece of burnt something. Now for the good part. Lots of choices and they give you ok to pile it one. Many options for seasonings and sauces. Rice bar and yogurt. Both are bottomless.   Folks stop in and go for it! Peace.

YC's is a great interactive meal. Start at the register and pay, then walk your way through the line picking your frozen meats, veggies, and topping with noodles and broths to make your custom stir fry meal. You'll see the pros with parchment paper in hand, smashing down the goods to make room for more. My fave meat is the beef, I love tons of celery, cabbage, carrots. I personally skip on the noodles to go for the steamed white rice. Also love the egg drop soup and breaking up some wonton strips into that. You pay for a takeout box, but it is always worth it for me to take home another full meal. Expect YC's burps for the next few hours. Warn your loved ones.

Skip the ballpark food, and get your grub on here after the game. Amazing customer service, and a Mongolian grill where they actually encourage squishing down the ingredients in your bowl if you want. About $13 for the big bowl, $14 ish for AYCE. I had a big bowl, and could only finish about half. Soda, tea, soup, rice included in the price. Worth the money.
I love coming here.  Being able to make my noodles the way I want is awesome plus the kids love it.  Very affordable too. It gets very busy around lunch time but the line moves fast.

Came in around 9 on Thursday evening they were closing down I understand that they close at 10 but the quality of the food should still be the same considering I'm paying the price for it very disappointed in the way I was treated by the staff and the quality of the food obviously been sitting there for a while was disgusting I will not be returning if you're open till 10 you should serve the same quality of food that you serve during the day

I have eaten here for years and years as the movie theatres and surrounding restaurants (and even an entire row of buildings!) has come and gone. YC's has remained and it's still as tasty as ever. Grab a bowl (don't bother getting the big one if you can save a buck, there's no way you'll be able to eat the full portion of even the smaller bowl, lol), grab a wax paper to smush all the good ingredients down into the bowl, and go to town. I like that they added extra bowls up by the sauces a while ago, since previously you were guaranteed to slosh sauce all over your tray :P  The ingredients are always fresh and tasty, they have a nice selection of options, and the sides at the end are nice (I like the tasty, if not a bit salty beef soup - add a glob of brown rice into it and mm it is delish!). Also, after trying Genghis grill - YC's system of keeping the meet choices cold/semi frozen is the way to go - the meat looked NASTY at Genghis in comparison.   It's not a fancy place, it's not the cheapest place for quick food... but man if you want to eat some dang tasty stir-fry until you need to unbutton your pants and call a flatbed truck to take you home - YC's is the place!

Foods always good! And love that you get soup, drink, rice and ice cream with your meal! My son loved the selection and of course the ice cream. The staff was helpful and really friendly, will definitely be back soon!
Way better then any of the other locations. The guy in there was super helpful with everyone. There's not much standing room when it gets busy but the food is amazing.

The food here is great. The lady at the front was a total b*** though. I'd rather visit the location on McClintock. This one charges you extra for everything. If you eat to go it's fifty cents more & they have something against splitting your plate with your kid. Like are you serious!

Ate at this restaurant Saturday november 14 and had my leftovers on Sunday november 15. Tuesday morning I woke up violently ill and could not hold in food or fluids all day tuesday.   Went to the urgent care tuesday evening and they promptly sent me to the ER to be treated for severe dehydration caused by "probably a food borne bacteria." I just finished my three day antibiotic course and am feeling much better, but now that I have had time to look at the facts and speak with the Maricopa County Department of Health, I can confidently say that my horrific three days of food poisoning were undoubtedly caused by YC's Mongolian Grill.  The fact that I was told someone else got a case of E.Coli with bloody stools just about a week before my poisoning really shored it up for me. YC's is apparently serving tainted or contaminated food. I would not recommend eating at this establishment. I must also make it clear that my noodles which I took home were transported from the restaurant to my refrigerator (20 minutes) and kept in the refrigerator until they were microwaved and consumed.

I have always been a fan of YC's.  I wrote a nasty review and I was personally contacted by the owner who apologized and wanted to make it up to us.  We went back to the same YC's and were amazed at the impeccable customer service.  We had someone helping us every step of the way!  The food is always great!  We didn't experience any integrity issues this time.  :)  I recommend anyone to go here if you have a great appetite.

My wife and I tried this place this evening.  The only reason I don't give it a 1-star rating is because neither of us died.  Otherwise, it was a poor experience and we won't be returning.  First, When we get our bowls and begin filling them up, there's no shrimp.  I ask about shrimp and am told it's $1 extra.  So, shrimp costs $1 extra from the $11.85 we each paid but you're forcing us to buy the ice cream and drink as part of the $11.85?  I should have asked if they can subtract $1 for each of our meals because neither of us wanted the ice cream and subtract another $2 from my wife's meal because she only drinks tap water.  Bottom line here, I resent that we're being forced to buy the extras as they're included in the price, but we're to be charged more if we want shrimp.  Hey, Genghis Grill down at Tempe Marketplace has shrimp on the bar and doesn't charge extra and doesn't force you to buy a drink and ice cream.  Second, the various sauces were poorly marked with bowls of sauces with no corresponding label or a label with no corresponding sauce.  There were even sauces that were obviously not what the corresponding label indicated.  It was difficult to know what we were putting with our bowls.  Third, my wife didn't finish all her bowl so she asked or a container to take it home.  They charged her $0.50 for a takeout box.  Seriously????  We won't return and will instead drive the extra 5 miles or so to the Genghis Grill at Tempe Marketplace the next time we want Mongolian BBQ.

I am a fan of Mongolian grills but this one creeps me out a little by not cleaning the grill between customers. They also wipe the seats and tables with the same towels. They don't seem to observe the same rules we're all taught.

My husband and I love this place! I can get so many great variety of veggies, and brown rice. They even have a great raspberry ice tea that I love! Everything is so inexpensive, the whole meal is under $15.

My favorite Mongolian BBQ joint in the Phoenix area. HUGE HUGE portions, the only place where they let you smash the meat with wax paper, so much sauce and even the side bar is delicious. DO IT and I dare you to finish everything in your bowl.

This place is amazing. I love coming here because I always get my fill and more. I don't even mind having to pay $.50 for a to go container because you get so much food for the price. And if you go at dinner it's an even better deal because frozen yogurt is included!!   The experience is amazing. I defiantly want all my friends to try this place at least once! ^..^

I love coming to YC's because I know the food will always be delish. I love making my own plate of food and I love seeing it cooked before my eyes! The staff is always super friendly and helpful every time I come back.

My friend took me here, said I had to go and now I have been twice! This place rocks! The first time I went they helped me get started and gave me a free togo box, normally they charge 50 cents for it (which sounds weird, but isn't until you go).  This is a build your own Asian Meal place! AWESOME!! You can pick your meat, your veggies and your sauce and they cook it up for you- so fun and so yummy- each time you go you can get what you want, but switch up the sauces or keep it the same and since it is build your own, you will definitely have leftovers and they are just as good the second time around!

We use to go to this place all of the time, until this past Saturday night when three out of the four of us ended up with food poisoning. I feel bad for posting this review, but for those of you who are reading it just be careful. We will never go back, which is a shame, but for so many of us to get food poisoning is not a coincidence. I'm just wondering how many other guests ended up getting sick that night as well.

This was my first time at a mongolian grill.  I wasn't sure what to expect.  Basically you fill your bowl with everything you want in it and someone else cooks it.  If you don't like your meal, you have no one to blame but yourself.    I thought it was odd that they charge for take-out boxes.     My wife thought that the pineapple & vanilla icecream reminded her of a Dole Whip from Disneyland.  I would come back for sure and next time see about following their recommendations for seasonings.

I visit one of the YC's locations almost every month. The process of picking your own ingredients and sauces, having them grilled for you, and the ultra fresh taste of food just cooked is unique. An amazing value at about $10! Their hot mustard sauce is spot on.

Tried this for dinner again last night...  This is such a good, healthy meal and at such a reasonable price. The ingredients are so fresh and the experience of getting it right off the grill is really cool. Dinner was exactly $10 each and included the drink, tax, etc...   The atmosphere here is nice for $10 meals. Lunch and dinner rush can get a little hectic.

We headed over to YC's on a Saturday night. A little more casual than we were looking for on a Saturday night, but that was our choice.   We had no idea what to do and one of their helpful employees explained everything. While I could have liked what I put together more I now have a better idea what to do for my next visit.  The best part was going to the car show just outside the door after dinner on a Saturday night.  This is the type of place Arizona needs more of.

Friendly hostess explained the process of how YC's works. There's two different bowls sizes that you can fill with as many ingredients you want. Protein options are pork, chicken, beef and fish. Veggies and sauces are endless. Each meal comes with a drink and a side of soup and rice (white or brown). The drink options consist of teas and Pepsi. There's also frozen yogurt available. My bowl was tasty. I added chicken and beef with udon noodles and a variety of veggies. I'll come back.
Go for the experience not necessarily for the food. Staff was friendly and helpful but I was not impressed enough to make it a regular eating spot.

This place is overall fantastic.  Been going for over 10 years.  It is always consistently good.  Service is always great.  (employees seem to stay there for long time)  Hard to find a better, fresher, and less expensive place to eat.  Very good value for the money!

I've been coming here since they opened, and visiting the Pavilions since it opened in the early 90's.  I'm also a reputable business owner, and a valley resident since '79.  I know good management and a good crew when I see one.  Geoff and his long time crew are amazing.  My wife and I eat here like clockwork every single week.  It is miraculous that they stay so on top of everything with the business/volume that they do.  The employees here are clearly a reflection of the 5 star management, and this is a well run operation.  I do have one complaint- I've gone to other "wok" places and Mongolian style places, expecting the same thing- boy am I spoiled from YCs... they don't even come close- we "woked" away without even eating at YC's competition.

Yc never disappoints your pretty much in charge&I love to be in charge you pick your protein,carbs,veggies and of course the delicious sauces/oils as well as seasoning salts as much or as little or you can just go to the servers which are very kind to help you out to make up your mind then after just wait for magic grill done by Mongolian specialist or I like to call them BBQ gurus to cook it all up for ya you will leave happy&on a full tummy oh an FYI don't forget to try out their soups for the day very tasty

This place is pretty good. I've been coming here for years. However the price seems to keep going up...used to take my family of 5 there for $35-40...now we are $65-$70...then if you don't finish they charge you for boxes to put your left overs in. They get you coming in and going out...we won't be frequent flyers any longer....too bad cause we really like this place.

Love the concept of pick-your-own veggies, meats and oils/seasonings and turn it into a high protein, tasty, hot stir fry meal.  I highly suggest you follow one of the recipes posted above the stir fry area if you're unsure of which seasonings and sauces you should use.  I used quite a bit of several sauces (well, I thought it was quite a bit) and the flavor wasn't terribly strong.  But it was still very tasty.  The only draw backs for me is there is little ambiance (it feels somewhat like a cafeteria) and you will be charged a dollar for a to-go box.  I'd rather be charged an extra dime for my meal than having folks being nickle and dimed for a to-go box.  It just doesn't leave me with a good feeling to discover, after a nice meal, that I have to pay to take my leftovers home.  I believe they have no problem with folks bringing in a plastic container, though.

If you don't like this spot it's your own fault for not making your bowl the way you should have. Fresh meat and vegetables cooked right in front of you so it HAS to be fresh and hot. Getting your sauces correct and also using lots of it. I always get a second bowl to pour flavor sauce in. Absolutely delicious!  Staff was also very friendly,  been eating here for 15 years and never doesn't satisfy.

This place can either be 2 star or 4 star, depending upon the quality of the veggies they use. Sometimes the veggies are nasty and seem expired. Other times they are fresh and crisp. They offer plenty of sauces to flavor your dish with. However, the meat here is nasty as hell. It is frozen, nasty crap. I stick to veggies here... Overall good place if they keep their stuff fresh.

I do like a mongolian BBQ, but I have to say that this one is just average.  Although they have a selection of meat that's so-so, they don't back it up with many additional items.  Their spice selections are standard, and they have recipes for sauces on a board WAY high in the air (I missed it until someone pointed me in the right direction) but the grillers cook your food in a way that kind of creates a flavoring that is a melange of the other things cooking.  Filling, satisfying, but not all that remarkable.

Went into the resturant last night with my husband and daughter and baby. Didn't know how the whole system worked... The lady that checked us in explained everything and was super friendly. The food tasted nice and fresh and the portion was huge. The kids were super excited to find out the meal came with ice cream at the end. Right before we left the lady working at the front came and asked how everything was. The costumer service was on point and we will definitely be going back.

There was a Mongolian BBQ place I went to for 20 years and apparently they went out of business. So I've been looking for someplace new to replace it and saw this one while driving around and thought I would check it out. Overall, everything was pretty good. They have a nice selection of veggies, noodles, meat and sauces to choose from. I didn't try any of the soups but my bowl was pretty good. I'm sure I will be back again now that I understand the process a little better and have tried the food.

This is your typical Mongolian grill. Fill your bowl, watch it shrink and then stuff your face. Good food, decent prices. Military, veterans and seniors get a 10 percent discount. Soft serve ice cream is also available.

Ugh, I hate how it's $11.50 for a bowl. Granted, it's a pretty big size- but still a ridiculous price. Might as well go for the $12.50 ayce. At least then you can vary your taste buds.  The food itself is good. Lots of choices and sauces. I like how they write all the sauce recipes out on the board for you so that you can make something better than whatever concoction you'll come up with.   If you don't prefer noodles- you should just fill up your bowl with beef and veggies and eat it with the complimentary rice at the end! ;)  The drink machine, soups, ice cream, and choices of brown/white rice at the end are a nice touch.
If I had to pick a last meal, it'd be ycs! Just saying! I could live off of it! Come to Phoenix !!!

We moved to Colorado awhile back and I can honestly say we have not found anything like this. I've been coming here since they first opened as a kid. I don't remember if it was this location! My dad and I went every Sunday! Every friend or family member who walked my path I take them here for dinner now I live 1000 miles away and CRAVE this place!!! I miss it!!!! I think I need to franchise Denver LOL!!! We even got a free dinner for leaving a rave review!!!

This may not be the best Mongo Bongo I have ever had but it is the best in PHX. The staff is always nice and helpful and you don't like the meal, well you made it, try again.  It is not cheap but reasonable for what you get. I drag my friends there once and they always want to go back.  Give it a shot you wont be sorry.

This is good mongolian for a chain-like restaurant.  I have been here a fews times and I was very happy with the service, and freshness of the food!  I'll be back again. Oh be sure to fill your sauce bowl up to about 3/4 so you selection of flavors dont get watered down.

The food was excellent!  Just how Mongolian BBQ should be. The staff was very helpful. The hostess was able to help my mother who has food allergies and made sure my son had a full bowl. I can't wait to go back.

Great place to eat when you're really hungry. I'm a big guy and a small bowl packed is plenty of food. You feel like you're eating healthy but the sodium content is really high so don't be too fooled.
Me and my family love this place. My #1  favorite. They need more locations Glendale, peoria , metro phoenix would be great.

The best place to eat a healthy bowl. Only thing I hate are the locations there are just not enough locations. I would spend so much $ here to eat with my family if they had a Glendale/Peoria location even metro Phoenix at the least. I only have a very lil opportunity to stop by when work takes me near by.  1 place to eat.
Great variety of fresh items, inexpensive, fast, efficient and friendly service! What else could you want ? A winner in my book!

I revisited this location recently as a comp from the manager and, it was a wonderful experience.  The (assuming newer) manager runs a tight ship at this location, and it shows.  Patrons were much more well behaved than last time and the service was more friendly than I remember as well.  I LOVE Mongolian food but unfortunately any time I crave it I have to treck from the West side of town to the land of great Mongolian restaurants, which is the East Valley.    Normally, I go to the location on the 101 and Indian Bend, but my fiancé and I decided that we liked this location much better after our visit as it has a more laid back calmer atmosphere.  Everything was clean and organized.  I avoided the fish altogether this time, and opted for steak/chicken.  The veggie variety was amazing and they have sriracha available as well.  Sriracha is my new found LOVE, and any place that offers it, is A-OK with me.  All in all, I will definitely return, and thank the manager for making me a believer and a HUGE fan of this location of YC's Mongolian Grill.

I love this place, I come here quite often for lunch or dinner.  Only dislike is having to pay. 50 cents for a Togo box...? I mean it's only. 50 cents but still just include it in your pricing don't make me have to dish out some coins which I never carry.

I'm not really sure what just happened to me.  I just ate a bunch of flash-frozen meat that was white, curled, and stiff.  I put it in a bowl and mashed it with a napkin, put some even less fresh looking veggies on it, and handed it to an angry mexican who proceeded to cook it on something that looked like the urinals in Sun Devil Stadium.  I didn't like preparing my own food for this price, I don't like that they KNOW the meat shrinks but won't give you a decent sized bowl to put enough in it - although...with as nasty as the meat tasted, why would you want any more of it?  I might go back here and just do noodles and sauce.  The noodles were the only thing that seemed safe to eat and the sauce (you make your own) was the only thing redeeming about this place.  I was definitely missing the Wendy's that used to be in this spot.

I get really excited about YC's Mongolian BBQ. I love the concept, prices, and how quick it is on a busy night. They also help you choose your sauces which can be rather confusing if you dont know what you are doing. I am a picky eater so it is nice that i get to pick everything that goes into my bowl. Also, you really get a ton of food.   No complaints, well maybe that there isnt one close to me.   Check it out!

Kinda went in the wrong line and messed up but the woman at the from was super nice. She said that I pay first and thanks for being honest :). She walked me through it all and wished me a good day. Just got over being sick so wanted something basic. She helped me avoid anything that would upset my stomach and I went on my merry way.   I can't believe I lived near this and haven't been once ever!

I just don't understand why you would pour an entire pitcher of water on the food your grilling. All the sauce and spices you add to your meal just get washed right off. Bye bye flavor.... Also, the cooks need to find some personality. I get you're probably working for minimum wage but your tip jar would fill up faster with a simple "Hello, how are you?"

Mmmm! Love it! Pack as much as you can into the bowl and bring home your leftovers! I can get two meals out of this place for the price of 1! Always a good go to, happy there is one in Gilbert close to my house.
the absolute best! if you're going to try any YC's around for the first time, this would be the go-to location

I have eaten there before and I'll keeping eating there. The food and veggies are so fresh. Service is great as they will mix your flavor for the wok. I think the ice cream should be free. Asking a $1.00 for a cup after spending $22.00 for two people for lunch is odd. Regardless, the flavors are fantastic the way everything is cooked. Having a huge selection of drinks is great and the rice selection is a wow. This is a must stop for lunch.
Excellent food and staff. I start a vegan diet and the staff help me around to pick my food

Thank goodness for places that are allergy friendly. My fiancé was craving something Asian flavored, but finding a place that knows when the sauce has shrimp or oyster sauce in it can be tricky. This place has everything labeled by soy/gluten/fish etc and I didn't have any issues post meal!
Make sure you mush as much as you can in your bowl, hee hee. :)  A fun and good place for some Asian!

So far is the best mongolian grill ive been too.  maybe cuz is the first official mongolian grill ive been to. ive been to buffets that have a grill in the back but is not the same.  This one was diff and more delicious. Ive been here a couple of times and let me tell u is really good. i like the fact that u can make ur own sauce. Also i like that u can take ur left overs and eat them later.

I love Mongolian grills, and YC's has to be among the best I've had.  Infinite combinations of deliciousness for an extremely reasonable price, and the employees are always friendly and helpful.  Drinks are included, and so is rice, wonton noodles, and soup.  I've never left hungry, that's for sure.  I only wish they'd open one on the west side of the valley so I could eat there more often.    A great place.  Try it.

Its fun to make your own bowl, controlling how much meat and what type of veggies go in it.  The Sauce station is where the magic happens, so much to pick from.  Then after all the goodness is jammed into your bowl you hand it off to the cook to fry it up which takes about 3 minutes.  The wait staff is really fun and outgoing and since it was our first time, our waitress showed us the ropes.  My wife and I will be back for sure.

Visiting Tempe on work, I was excited to see a Mongolian BBQ, as California doesnt seem to have good quality mongolian places. I walked in and ordered a huge bowl - seemed like a good price at $11.50 for a bowl, drink, and rice. Food was great and cooked well.  The fun thing started when I checked my credit card that I was charged $29 instead of $11.50. Interestingly, I remembered that the lady who charged me at the hostess desk didnt even offer me my receipt. A few days later, I called the manager and let him know. He took down my name, address and how much I was overbilled, and told me that he would send me a check in the mail and call me when he did so. Two weeks, and I am yet to hear from him.  Most of all - no apology for screwing a customer and over billing him.  Needless to say, I am never going back when I am back in town for business. I have also let our team of 500 employees in the building next door about this issue. I am guessing a lot of folks are interested in never going back.

Super friendly staff. Delicious food. Good atmosphere (mood lighting).  They encourage you to pile your bowl as high as you want which is awesome as you have two meals worth of leftovers. Make sure that you add plenty of sauce to your food otherwise it may taste a little bland (especially if you pile it super high like I do). I recommend at least ten scoops of sauce for a super full bowl. They also have soup, rice, won tons and fountain drinks included with the price. This place is definitely a great value and is delicious to boot. Highly recommended.

This is a neat stir fry place with a design-your-own approach. They have a nice variety of meat, vegetables and sauces you can create for your meal.  The place is well maintained and looks pretty modernized. The line may look crowded as you first walk in, but it moves pretty fast. For a place with a good cooked-to-order meal, it's still less of a wait than if you sat down to dine.   The meat shrinks during cooking, so make sure you get a double portion. There is an option for a 50 cent take out container, if you strategize and pile high enough (use wax paper at the start of the line to pack down the food) its petty easy to get enough for a second meal for later.  Words of caution though-the rice noodles are harder to stack, get wheat noodles if you have your heart set on seconds. Also, the entire bowl comes out very very hot at first when you sit down,   Edit: I was originally perplexed to see the chicken frozen in rolls, but received a message from the owner who thoughtfully described the preparation to plate process, to create fresh chicken pieces that are ready to easily be cooked the day after they are received. Now I am even more sold on this place.  .

5 stars for customer service. It was my first time in, and they were very helpful and friendly.   They had a nice selection of food to put in a bowl. I appreciated the vegetarian and gluten-free options.   I did not care much for the soup or the won tons. The rice was ok. My bowl turned out good, but I was kind of surprised at the price. It seemed pretty expensive considering the soup and wontons were just ok.   I might go back, but I'm not in a huge hurry.
I never get tired of this place. I always enjoy my meal and you can always leave full, no matter how hungry you are when you come in.

I like the options here and it's okay food but just not my favorite place to go.  Hubby and  I go once in a while when we want something different but really it tastes like a lot of other Asian restaurants only you get to decide what you put in it.
Good food but prices going up and bowls getting smaller.  .50 to take home leftovers that don't fit in your small more expensive bowl.

I used to really love this place, but the last time I went I think I got food poisoning. My stomach was killing me for hours after I ate here. I'm not sure if I got a bad batch of tofu, or if they did't cook everything through, but I was in a great amount of pain. They do however accommodate to various allergens which is good. For example, if you're Vegan, they'll clean off the grill for you before cooking your food, which is very kind. My dad didn't have any problems with his meal, so I think the issue might've been the tofu because he got beef and was fine.

The portions here are huge! Usually, mongolian bbq places give you a tiny bowl and I find all kinds of ways to maximize the space but here I pretty much don't need to. (although I still do and I end up with 2 big takeout boxes. haha) besides that, they give you rice and soup. so it's a good deal.  I'll tell you my secret: first you unroll the frozen pieces of meat and you flatten them with your napkin. Cover the bottom of the bowl. then you line broccoli with the heads pointed out of the bowl all around the rim. This makes your bowl bigger. then you pile up everything else you want on top. haha. :D

OK, this place has always been pretty good, and is great if you know the ingredients/flavors you like, but don't want to cook it yourself (Like at a Hot Pot place).  I have never written a review because I was eating there before I had ever visited Yelp, but recently they added a new "Thai Peanut Chili Sauce" and several seasonings that you can add to your food (IE: lemon pepper, cumin, and some combination spices).  This is a great improvement, and really increased my impression of their overall quality.  With these new improvements, I would say YC's is the best Mongolian BBQ I have personally had.
Loved this place for years, food is still great but now it's priced too high for a lunch. I remeber when lunch was $7, now at $12 I cannot afford it, I didn't get a raise
delicious, lots of food! happy people who work here and seem to love their job and working together creates a positive environment for the customers! PLEASE OPEN THE FROYO MACHINE FOR LUNCH

Usually the service is good but tonight we had a horrible experience. The workers kept giving my boyfriend a hard time for how he was filling up his bowl. (And laughing at him too for the way he was doing it. SO unprofessional) the cook kept giving my boyfriend dirty looks too. The cook didn't even property cook my meal correctly. My eggs were runny/mushy and my veggies were undercooked. And it's kind of ridiculous to charge for a to go box. Like I said, in the past we've always usually had a positive experience which is why I'm being generous giving 3 stars, but tonight was just not up to par with what we are use to and for that I'd rate it maybe a 2.

I've been here a few times but always prefer Genghis. YC's is a place where you get to make your own stir fry. Compared to Genghis, you will get way bigger portions which is definitely a plus. Also, they offer rice and other things for sides in addition to your bowl. I don't know if I just don't get the right sauce or what... I like things saucy. Whether it be wings or anything really that requires sauce. It needs to be super saucy. This applies to my stir fry. Whenever I use their sauces, it seems that the sauce is super thin and just not as tasty as Genghis. :( It is possible that I just haven't put the right ingredients together, though. Maybe someday I'll try it one more time to see if I get it right.

Friendly staff who were helpful in explaining how the food bar and prices worked. The meat choices were limited. Vegetable selection was ok. All the sauces were a bit bland. Don't be afraid to go crazy on it since they don't stick too much during the stir fry. They do have soup and rice also. The ice cream left a weird feeling on my tongue.

3.5 Stars  Lunch time it's $9.00 for a large bowl and a drink.  Comes with unlimited brown or white rice and soup.  Not a bad deal at all.  This is your typical Mongolian BBQ spot... thin frozen meats, veggies, sauce, slap onto round grill, eat.  My only complaint with this place is I feel there are too many sauce choices.  My favorite Mongolian BBQ spot (near UCLA) had two options:  garlic Yes/No and spicy Yes/No, other than that the sauce master did his work and the dish turned out amazing.  YC's has like 10 different sauce combination they present to you and I feel that the last 3 times I've been here I could have chosen better.... but frankly, I don't know because I never remember which one I chose previously.  In this case, like AbuJ likes to say, too much customization is not good.  Perhaps I'm just "chasing the dragon" and trying to get it to taste like my favorite UCLA joint and I'll never reach that high again no matter how much I try, but damnit, I'm going to try a few more times since UCLA is a 6hr drive on a good day.  The hostess / cashier was easy on the eyes, as was the sauce girl.  Both pretty friendly too.  Girls tend to flirt with me, so nothing unusual here.  +.5 stars for this.

I am a huge fan of YC's. I work right next to this location, so we frequent it for lunch. My favorite thing about YC's is not only the fact that the food is fantastic, but they let you pile the food as high as you can. It's always a competition amongst my co workers to see who can stack their food the highest. You just have to buy a $.50 cent to go box and you have lunch for the next day.   The staff is always super friendly, the restaurant is clean, and the variety of food never disappoints. I have absolutely no complaints for YC's.

First time and I definitely will become a regular. Several locations around the east valley. Paleo and gluten free friendly! Lots of veggie and meat items to choose from to fill your bowl.   Tip: wax paper sheets at beginning of ala Carte line are provided so you can smash down the meat and veggies as you go down the line and fit more into your bowl.

Yet again, you guys amaze me and my partner with your wonderful service and food. Thanks for helping speed up the line with helping others with getting their plates mixed and keeping the toppings stocked. Again thank you we will be back more and more.
Staff was more than helpfull, I felt like it was a great value, if you like great khans you will love this place way more of a variety, food was delicious! I wish there was one in san diego!!

I love this place!!! The staff is always very kind and helpful, the food is fresh, and I love the options and flavors they have. The way they price for children is PERFECT (.55 for year year of age) Also, you can't beat that you also get soup, rice, a drink and ice cream with your dinner.

First time here and the whole experience wow'd us. I have never had better customer service in a restaurant.  They were so helpful and friendly. The food is so good! I had the Chefs Favorite sauce and it was very flavorful. Even though we live in Avondale, we will be back. Hope to see one open in the west valley!

I remember coming to YC's as a kid.... I loved mixing all of the sauces and piling my bowl high with noodles and veggies.... I loved that they had soft serve ice cream...crispy wontons..... soup..... Well, nothing has changed! YC's is exactly as I remember it from years ago. The only thing that changed is it's actually a little pricey.... over 10$ even at lunch. Closer to 15 at dinner. Extra charge for a to go box (which is 100% necessary....trust me). Anyway, I loaded my bowl with all kinds of veggies.... added some of their weird freeze dried beef (it looks weird, but it tastes good, so who am I to judge)....piled noodles on top.... and poured on various sauces including a ridiculous amount of chili oil and garlic. Don't get me wrong, this is no authentic Asian food restaurant....but the flavor is pleasant regardless. Between my noodles, two different types of soup, and some wonton chips with sweet and sour sauce I was super stuffed and had two additional meals from the leftovers. I would definitely return...but probably only at lunch.

The Manager was kind enough to reach out to us after our unfortunate first experience.  My hubby and I looked forward to a more positive return visit-and we were pleased with our meal.  We both created a bowl with the Kung Pao sauce and it was very tasty.  The restaurant was clean and maintained.  We enjoy healthy eating and are glad we have a spot to return to when we get a "yen" for YC's.
I like eat a lot of vegetables and I love them stirfried why sees doesn't excellent job and I enjoy going there OK so then I've got there

Aside from the employees who feel the need to police you to make sure you don't share, (a rule which I understand when I read it, when the cashier explains it, AND when the busser fills me in) it's generally a clean, well maintained establishment. You can't complain about the food, since it's up to you to create your own dish.  Wish they had egg as an add in option like Ghengis Grill.   Drink and soft serve yogurt are included in the price of your meal. To go boxes for fifty cents a pop.

They have a clean, efficient setup, a selection of decent (flash frozen) meat, and plenty of fresh veggies and sauces. If the meat were fresh or the price a bit lower I'd add the fifth star, but ultimately everything else in your experience comes down to your skills. I get 3 tasty meals out of my visit, and here is my strategy:  1. Get some butcher paper and repeatedly crush down your meat to create a secondary "meat bowl" effect. This allows more meat and less mess.  2. Spices: don't be shy.  3. Veggies: feel free to have a small pile, and use butcher paper to scrunch it down.  4. Noodles: gotta do the trifecta, but end with a big pile of wheat noodles. They weigh everything down.  5. Sauce: if following these instructions, double the recipe on the board, pour a few scoops on the noodles themselves, and add some hot chili oil for good measure.  6. Cooking: don't miss the crunchy and sweet things at the end. If you like those things, they are available.  7. Tips: tip the cook. It's hot back there.  8. Post-Game: You will not finish this. You will have extra sauce on the bottom. Get 2 bowls of brown rice to soak up that delicious sauce and get two to-go cartons worth of awesome leftovers. They will be better the next day after soaking up flavors overnight.  9. Label your cartons. People are crazy.  There ya go. Happy eating!

This is Asian your way! You pay for one of three sizes of bowls that you can heap with a nice variety of vegetables, meats, and noodles. They are all displayed in a buffet line. Once your bowl is filled, you proceed to the sauce table. Here you select your grilling sauces. Someone will offer to custom blend your sauce. I like to be adventurous so I mix my own. You then proceed to the grill area where your dish is grilled before your eyes. My only issue is that they don't clean the grill between orders so someone with a food allergy could experience cross contamination. Your meal comes with rice, soup, a drink, and ice cream. This was a good experience. I thought the price was a little high. But you are encouraged to take home the leftovers.

I often stop here as a lunch nearby work. The people are always friendly and helpful.  Sometimes it is SUPER BUSY during lunch, bit I usually have time to eat and get back to work on time.  The food is great! The ingredients are fresh and well-cooked.  My go-to sauce? 3 YC's Own 3 Garlic 2 Ginger Hot Chili Oil Sriracha after cooking

My boyfriend brought me here almost 2-3 years ago, and since the first time, we've visited this location many, many times. It's a great place to go when you want a filling, healthy meal for lunch.  I've always been a fan of DIY/Cook it yourself places. (I.E. Korean BBQ and Hot pots.)  I usually try stuffing as many ingredients into the bowl, sometimes it requires punching down the frozen slices of meat you first throw in. And you have to get a lot of sauce otherwise you're not going to taste anything. When I first came here I had no idea on what sauce combinations to use, its nice they put up a sign above the grill so anyone new to YC's can start out from and branch out adding different combos.
2nd visit here years  The food is as good a time as it was the 1st I reckon this place the girls were very helpful and understanding and then you have the recommended come back again

My husband and I ate here after the car show last weekend.  The concept is part fun, part weird: watching them cook your food = fun. Trying to concoct your own meal, complete with spices, sauces, oils and "squishing" = a little weird.  The staff was very friendly and helpful. They explained the "squish" concept when I told them I was a first timer, and there was a helpful gentleman at the end of the line to help me make up a sauce.  I was weirded out by the shaved, frozen meat. It makes sense that they need to keep it this way (frozen to maintain safety, shaved thin to cook fast), but it is still a bizarre sight and I was hesitant to use it. All the veggies were super fresh, so I loaded up on those.  All you can eat soup, wontons, rice and soft serve. I was disappointed that the soups were so basic (chicken noodle and beef vegetable? How about some egg drop!?) The wontons were ok and the soft serve was meh. Didn't bother with the rice.  My problem was that, at the end of it all, I had a large bowl of not-that-great stir fry. How many times do you need to experiment until you find a sauce/spice/oil/cooking wine ratio that actually tastes good? THIS IS WHY I EAT OUT, PEOPLE....so I can get a guaranteed yummy meal, not take my chances!  And as another review stated, it is super odd to go down this buffet line watching people pile, stuff and cram food into these bowls, trying to get every last ounce of their money's worth. Yes, it shrinks a little while cooking, I'm sure. But people were acting like animals with the wax paper and extra bowls, using their entire body weight to smoosh their own food. Not an appetizing sight.  I might be willing to give it one more shot with another sauce compilation, but after that I think I'm done.

The bestie LOVES this place. The Husband LOVES this place. Needless to say, I spend a lot of time at YCs. Good fresh food, with nutritional information online so there are no surprises if you plan ahead -- great lunch place!

Bomb.Com as always!!! So good!! Went last night with a friend and we both made massive bowls. Enjoyed every bite. Even had a bite of the raspberry frozen yogurt which was delish. This place never disappoints. A little pricey ($12.50 per person) But worth it because it is so dang good! I definitely will be returning!
Great service and great food, sorry no beer... but worth it all. What more can you say, it is excellent for the price.

So I have visited this place several times in between my first review and this review and they have managed to keep their 5 star rating. Tonight was the epitome of it all! I could not believe how delicious my meal was. I did finally try a new sauce: Kung Pao, so I don't know if that was it or not but everything was cooked to perfection. It was the busiest I have ever seen the restaurant too.   The staff, which was clearly under a lot of pressure, did not compromise their customer service at all. There was a woman helping out the chefs who was extremely courteous and would help you out with whatever you want. She kept the line moving and was very efficient. The chefs were also really nice! My mom has a food allergy. When you mention you have a food allergy they clean the entire cook top and get new utensils. Most places have an attitude because it's extra work for them. Not this place, they were very nice and were able to accommodate my mom's request. Even when she asked for the food to be cooked well done with not a lot of water, the chef said "sure" and made her food to perfection.   Love this place!

So happy there is one of these in Chandler now!! I used to frequent the Indian Bend/101 location when I lived in Fountain Hills but since moving to Chandler, that's a bit of a drive for me...not that it's worth it because it totally is!  This location is set up a little bit different and I kind of like how the chips/rice/soup is separate from the cooking station...and I like how the drink station has it's own designated counter. It helps free up a lot of the traffic around the cooking area. The one thing I don't like is the cooking area seems to be very close to where people have to wait for their food to be cooked, which becomes very crowded and holds up the line. Also, when the chefs pour on water, the steam can engolf the people waiting for their food. Also, when the chef goes to clean the cook top, sometimes the dirty water splashes and hits people or gets mixed in with the cilantro and peanuts that's off to the side. I wish this was designed a little better because people literally trip over you, which can be annoying.   When I visited there were tons of fresh veggies and meats available and the place was very clean. Usually the sauce area tends to get really dirty but this one was relatively clean. They have all the standard veggies...to name a few: carrots, cabbage, spinach, celery, bean spouts, kale, green onions, tomatoes, broccoli, mushrooms, water chestnuts, and baby corn.   It's nice being able to create your own stir fry and choose how much of what you want goes in it. It's definitely a healthier alternative to burgers and fries....and much tastier if you ask me!

I've Only been to YC's one time after going to a place called Stir Crazy in Chicago with the same concept. My 'creation' was bad... Un edible .. But it was all my fault. I doused my meal in sauce,.. And salt.. And more sauce.. After receiving the tip from a boyfriend at the time that it was necessary. Oops.. But I did enjoy the soup and after adding plenty of rice to soak up the excess salt/sauce, it wasn't too bad. The ice cream was great and the people were friendly:) I'll be back experienced and with a much better rating :)

Five stars, you ask? Yes. Not one to be excessive, but having been a YCs follower since the scant, quarter-scrounging days of ASU, I adore the value and creativity behind the Mongolian grilling concept. I can have whatever I want, from full-on carnivorous bowl of spice to veggie-fied curry heaven. Noodles or rice, soup or wontons . . . all of the above--no restrictions. Just grab the gleaming, white bowl in the size you select, pay the charming server up front (remember to add in a dollar or two to tip the cooks) and off you go down the buffet line. Frozen meat is an oddity at first. Remember that it shrinks when cooked; so, put double what you expect to see on the other end. The wheat noodles, in their swirly curly happiness, expand; so, be sure not to go tower of Pisa on them. Here is my fave recipe for low-carb excess (like getting the colonel's fried chicken notes): turkey, sprouts, spinach, cabbage, carrot, zucchini, mushroom, tofu, scallion, broccoli . . . then ladles: two black bean, two orange, one Thai, three ginger, one garlic, one cooking wine, one sesame oil. I add a few jalapenos, sesame seeds and some cilantro to the mix before it hits the grill. The long wooden poles, surface-of-the-sun hot grill and dexterity will entrance you. The staff is attentive and focused on cleanliness. Top notch ratings in several publications, and I agree.

Pretty good. I only wish there was a way to remember which sauce I like. I always spend forever debating which to try and haven't managed to get it quite as good as the first time I came in. This place is a lot of fun. I recommend overstuffing your bowl and getting a box

Had lunch today for the first time. Everything looked clean and we'll stocked. Very informative greeter and cashier.  She walked us through the process and they stir-fried one of the best lunches we have had in a while. The sauce or something must have gone bad because in less than an hour my partner and I were throwing up and VERY VERY sick. 9 hours later we have stopped throwing up but have bad headaches. I have had food poisoning many times before and this is in the top ten.
Better than ever, they have tofu and a lot more vegetable options, I was really impressed after not eating here for many years.

I actually love Mongolian grills.  We paid at the beginning for the large bowl. For the two of us it was about 30 dollars. We got our food (their ingredients are not expensive and we're definitely on the older side. Cabbagw, carrots, chicken sliced thin, beef sliced the same way, water chestnuts, sprouts, etc.)  We started eating. We had so.e left over. Now remember this is not a buffet. They have a specific bowl you have to put the ingredients you want into it. You cannot stack the food higher than a certain point. That is why there are two sizes.  Remember we already paid and tipped. Now I ask for a to go box.  They told me it will be 50 cents. Excuse me? They tried to tell me it's based on the concept that people can put an uncontrollable amount of food on the plate. That is a lie. They have the silver bowl in the beginning which is used to control the portion of the food. I have worked in restaurants and they are not going to get away with this, at least mot with me. Yes, sometimes people are able to stack a lot of food in their bowl.  But for the quality of the ingredients, the ingredients themselves and the silver bowls used to keep it from going over a certain proportion, couple with (if under good management) the fact that some people eat less than others it evens out.  For the amount I had would have only cost about 5 dollars. They are makin g a profit.  How dare you wait until we are happy, full, and satiated, and paid for to say we have to pay for to go bowls!  Your solution is that I should pay for the bowls in the beginning?! No. I will not pay for to go bowls. That is rediculous! We asked if we took to much. They said no. Well then why are we getting charged! They are making a profit. We were happy and you get business.... why did you ruin it on this? You are not a buffet. Even buffets have to go orders. You pay them fill up the plate as much as you want and leave.  It's not about the 50 cents it's the principal.  It's insulting. We did not take to much food, I didn't finish it so I wanted to take it home.

Always a safe bet!  We eat at YC's weekly. It is a consistently great meal made just the way you want it.  Staff is friendly, and you will never leave hungry!  Their prices have recently increased, and frozen yogurt is now an additional charge (at dinner too).

When you can't decide what to eat and you're in the area, this is a decent spot. Buffet style but you make your own bowl. I got the large bowl thinking I couldn't pack in the protein or noodles in a regular size but I was fooled. I would definitely recommend this place.

Came here for the first time and their food was delicious! I was confused on what to do since I hadn't been here before but everyone here was so willing to help! Price is fair for what they offer and their soups of the day were vegetable chicken and spices beef (both were awesome).

So I thought they were similar with Genghis Grill - yes they were except that GG has wider selection of meat. I did not know about the "fisting" and smashing of the meat to make room for more LOL . I asked my husband what the onion-skin paper is for that were sitting beside the meat counter. Come here with some strong fist and smash your meat all the way to the bottom and that is how you get more food!! It was fun. I like that they have bamboo shoots veggies that's the only veggie I get, and really it's magic that even if you put a little bit of all the sauce they have, still comes out very tasty! So you don't have to really worry about your food not coming out yum, the amazing cook will probably do the magic! By the way, small bowl to me would be good for 2 decent size meals!

I've been to various locations around the valley and they are pretty much the same. I enjoy the concept of creating my own meal. You can get help with the creation of your own sauces if you need it. I've either followed their recipes provide on a large chalkboard or just experimented with my own concoction.  I've never been disappointed. I'm marking this location down 1 star only because there was a woman walking around sweeping and pulling dirt into all the isles. That was followed by a push mop where she would randomly shake it. The most sits right where customers bring there food to be cooked on the grill. It just didn't seem professional or hygienic.

A clean, efficiently run Mongolian Grill?  The standard assortment of meats, veggies, and noodles, with fresh and plentiful selections.  A massive selection of sauces, including recommended mixes to get typical flavors?  Good to decent pricing (appreciate that it comes with a beverage, but I can see how that might rub others the wrong way).  All in all a very enjoyable experience, I'll absolutely be back!

I came back to YC's this past Saturday night and it seemed like the employees were really staying on top of keeping the buffet line organized and clean as well as the dining area.  However, the people there were being careless and letting the part of the tongs that their hands touched fall back into the food! C'mon people, that's gross!  I think YC's should develop a way to reduce the transfer of germs to food - like maybe installing hooks where the tongs can be hung so they are not thrown back into the food?  Also maybe a hand sanitizer station before entering the buffet line?  Just throwing ideas out there!  Overall, a good healthy dining experience.

The management of YC's Grill did take the feedback well and offered us another chance to visit them.  The feel was much better compared to our previous experience with them and hope they keep it up! Great food choices, meats, veggies, carbs, sauces..turns out into delicious combinations.   They have earned our business again!

Lets just say that this place was like home to me for 4 years when I was in COLLEGE. The food is great and if you pack the bowl high enough it will last you for days. Five stars aren't enough. The only negative thing I have to say is, WHY ISN'T THERE A YC'S IN CHICAGO YET?
Other than paying for to-go bowls, the place is good. The food tastes great. Make sure to ask them to clean the cooking table before cooking your meal.

I really like this place!  They make eating your veggies fun and easy.  Being veggie, I skip the meat section altogether (which has a good selection by the way) and pile on the cabbage, broccoli, mushrooms, tomatoes, and tofu - yum!  Then, there are several types of noodles and a huge spread of sauces, oils, and spices to add as well.  I think it's best to use a separate bowl for your sauce mixing and also make sure to grab a piece of wax paper to help smush your ginormous food pile down while you're loading to maximize space!  A small bowl will run you about $10 and a large, $11 for lunch - prices jump up about $2 for dinner.  Your meal also includes soups, wontons, rice, and a drink.  I think they may also have an unlimited option - which scares me a little bit!  :/  Pretty good deal considering I always leave stuffed after eating just the small-sized bowl!  One after thought I had was that this place might be problematic for people who have food allergies (poultry, peanuts, shellfish, etc.), as all the food is prepared on one of two large grills - which they don't really clean between customers.  Just a heads up!

This was not my first time at a YC's restaurant but my first time at this one.  The staff were very friendly and helpful, even offering to make my sauce for me.  Food was delicious (cuz I picked it) and was cooked perfectly.  The restaurant was clean and well kept.  My wife and I are already talking about coming back.

This place really isn't bad. It just isn't great. If are going to go to any kind of chain restaurant then YC's is probably a good choice. You get to pick your raw ingredients and they cook em up for you right there. The food tasted pretty good but as far as the quality of the raw ingredients I wasn't very impressed.   I actually would recommend this place for someone looking for a very fast meal (since the wait time is close to zero), and it's true that it's healthier than a burger joint, but I guess my bar for "healthy food" is just much higher than this place.

We went around 830 pm on a Friday evening, Ordered the Unlimited. So Go up for 2nd serving don't finish it all. Ask for a 2 go box they tell me NO. WTH I Paid The Extra. I feel this should be disclosed before paying for extra.

There are a lot of reviews of YCs and they seem to be pretty accurate but I will throw my opinion into the mix. YCs is a really fun place. All of the employees seem to really like working there and they are always exceptionally friendly.   The food portions are enormous if you pack it down into your bowl (I recommend doing son). Get a small bowl on the side for your sauce (you don't have to fit that into your mess of veggies and meat)! and that makes everything a lot easier.  As for flavor I think it's pretty good. I don't recommend going off in your own direction on the sauce, follow their recipes. Every time I've done one on my own it hasn't been as good.  If you like this concept though and want more for taste then go to Genghis Grill. The portion is slightly smaller but the taste is much better.

This place was great! You get to pick whatever you want to, throw it in a bowl and create your own sauce for it to be cooked in. Perfect for picky eaters! When you place your order get to go boxes as there is a 15 cent charge for these and if you are getting a large you will have leftovers (even the husband did). All of the ingredients were super fresh and there were a lot of options. There were two friendly ladies that came out and helped my daughter and I make our sauces based off of the recipes on the wall, but you are more than welcome to create your own. This is a great, quick dinner option for a busy family that is really hungry and looking for leftovers. Enjoy!

This place is delicious. It's a build-your-own type of place. You get a bowl and add your choice of meat, vegetables, noodles, and sauce. You can stack it as high as you want to. For two large bowls it was $24. It came with two drinks, two servings of wontons, and two soups. Can't wait to go back! I did take off one star because they carry Pepsi products instead of Coke.
Love this place! Loads of choices, fresh veggies, very kind helpful workers and clean place :) would recommend can't wait to go back

One of my friends took my to YC's years ago during my time at ASU. I was skeptical and scared to try something new. Since then this has remained one of my favorite places to eat.  The place looks very confusing to new comers, so it's always good to go with a YC's veteran to show you the ropes. :) Take as much meat as you want, as much veggies, noodles and then it's up to you to make your own mixture of saucy goodness before handing it over to the good people that man the frying station. They have a plethora of great ingredients to make a delicious sauce for your stir fry. Ginger, Orange, Garlic, Sweet and Sour, and lots others. Above the cooking stations are steps to make different styles of sauce, but I always like going with my instincts and making my own. It's just more fun.   They also have soup, chinese noodles and white, brown rice to go with your meal and a drink comes with the cost. Love that.   I always leave full and usually have lots leftover to bring home. Its fun to get creative with your food here, watch it being cooked, and loving how it tastes. All for a great price. I can't say enough great things about YCs.

Pretty good food. Kinda pricy for the amount of food you get, but it is enjoyable. I'd definitely recommend this for somebody looking to get some freshly made mongolian style food! you mix your whole meal yourself and the cook will stir fry for you.
$12.50 includes meal one time thru, soup, rice, drink, ice cream, to go carton. Delicious, well worth the dollar to value ratio.

First time here and first time at a mongolian grill period.....nice experience.....staff is so helpful and attentive from the moment that you walk through their doors up until you leave....they did great at making our first experience pretty dang good....you pac what u want how high u want it and if u don't have enough of meat they will let u know to fill it up to the rim..... if u don't know what kind of sauce u want u got a staff member  down there to make life a lil bit easier lol....no but seriously this place is great....will be coming back indeed!!!!! it's located back by Home depot I almost missed it....clean, Great customer Service and I'm a very happy customer!!!!! See u all later!!!!!

I can't really hype about YC's. It's good, and I'll hand them that, but it's not a 4-5 star place you should take a date. It's build your own meal and have some hispanic men with sticks toss it around a hot circle.   The meat is so thinly shaven that once it cooks down it's like digging through to find a needle in a hay stack to find it. They do have TOFU for all you veggie heads out there, but I wouldn't trust the grill they toss it around on. It's not like they clean it after every use. Plus who knows what's in the sauces.  The noodles you can load on like no other. As you stand in line, you will see people building their food dome. Pretty self explanatory.  The noodles are awesome thick chewy. -Definitely- ask for a to-go box upon ordering, unless you really think you can finish that mother load of carbs. This stuff is better as leftovers anyway. Way worth the 50 cents.   Soup is just okay, but you gotta love those addictive fried won-tons. I love grease. You can feel the grease smash back out of them when you bite into the crispy shell. Again, you can get as many as you want. Same with a bucket of brown and white rice they have for serve.  During dinner hours they allow you to have free self serve/soft serve frozen yogurt from their machines. The cones are junk. Nasty cardboard like cones, and the frozen yogurt is VERY "so so". Not worth it if you ask me.   Even though they have tons of great perks, it's still just a place to get stuffed on cheap food. Lunch $8, Dinner $10.

Never ate at a mongolian place before and its okay for fast food. You can make it as healthy or unhealthy as you want and the bowls hold a lot more food then you would think. But in the end everything is super salty (even the soups at the end, just salt ridden) and your not always sure what sauces/flavors would go with what you just put into your bowl. Staff is friendly and the place is clean.

Well it's my first time trying this place. hubby has always been mentioning to how he wants to bring me to this place one day. So, finally I get to try it!  I like the concept of grab how many that you can LOL :-D it's fun to just put how many you want in your plate or should I say bowl! haha. So you get to choose what you want for your stir fry- they have all kinds of meat, beef, chicken, pork..and they have cod fish too which is good!  So what I did was, I put all but beef haha!   and of course there's different veggies to throw in. You get to choose the kind of sauce you want..I like mine super spicy!  and the last part is for them to cook it for you which is so much fun to watch watch.
